title: Lots of caves
review: There are lots of small caves with different name. We need to walk down. Be careful of your head and also mind your steps as the stone are sometime slippery.

title: Nothing special
review: Nothing special was thete in the place. There is nothing to see except paying high fees for entry. For aged people it is a strictly no place.

title: A set of 5-7 small caves
review: I was here in january with my family. There are around 5-7 small caves, in which one can go thru the narrow path. these are very small ones takes 4-5 minues to go in and come out. Otherwise there is nothing much

title: Good place
review: Before you visit the place ensure that you have a slim waist line and flexible body. The caves are well made and you will have proper adventure.

title: worth visiting not good for fat people.
review: The caves are pretty much amazing and it does have a worth visiting if you are going to Nainital since the caves are very historical and natural. The caves earlier used to shelter some animals. The caves have pretty much fun and help to put in some Adrenaline through your blood.

title: Amazing place
review: Eco cave garden is situated in Sukhatal just 3.7 Km away from Tallital Bus stand and easily reachable by Mall Road by taxi or any other means. This park is maintained by Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam(KMVN) a Government of Uttarakhand Agency. Cave garden is a network of interconnected caves & hanging garden which offers the glimpse of Himalaya wildlife through different six caves with the forms of Tiger, Panther, bats, squirrel, flying fox & apes cave are some of the famous caves in the garden and main attraction for the tourist & children.

title: Better view.
review: Good and better to take pictures as the cave is on the top of the Nainital do visit for some great cave adventures.

title: Panaroma view from top
review: It is one of the popular tourist attraction famous for its interconnected caves and hanging garden.

title: Visit to cave garden
review: It was an amazing trip,altogether new experience. It was an adventurous trip. The caves are very well maintained and must visit place, when in Nainital.

title: Cavorting in the caves
review: A fun place for youngsters. An adventurous place which tests flexibility and the agility of each one of us. The caves are interconnected and the difficulty gradually increases making the heart beats fasten .Worth a visit .

title: Adventurous
review: A natural cave park.  There are quite a few of them.  Few of the caves are quite narrow and adventurous.  It's fun going through the caves.  Should give it a try.

title: Its Fun!
review: The Caves are situated not more than 3 km from Nainital and the place is a gem. It is a highly enjoyable place with all shapes and sizes of caves. The caves are small yet challenging at a few points. Do not expect too much, but it is enjoyable enough. The toughest ones are the Bat Caves and the Ape cave. Highly recommended.

title: excellent adventure
review: This is a great place to have some fun and adventure, the caves are good and if you enter it will need little effort to cross it.

title: Wonderful place
review: This place has many caves in which you could experience the nature. There is proper lighting inside the caves.

title: Nothing Much at this place
review: Visited this park on insistence of our Taxi driver. You will soem caves & bit if greenery. Not worth gate money & time we spent. Off course we came out within 15 mins.

title: Adventure in the lap of Nature
review: The cave gardens are a must visit place when in Nainital. In the winters especially when the climate is very pleasant. The rocks are ice cold if you touch them. This place will give you an experience of the caves for real.

title: Not suitable for kids, old ages and women.
review: We visited this place on 1st Dec 2018, there are total 6 caves in this area but we have seen only two caves. caves are risky for old peoples, kids and women.

title: Very good experience
review: There are almost 4caves in the garden bit difficult to cross the caves but its a very good experience. Do visit if you are in Nainital.

title: Nice place to spend some time
review: totally about 6 caves spread across the garden. The approach is slightly steep to the garden and some of the caves have supporting ropes. We went till the enterance to each cave and came, except tiger cave where I went completely in and came. Spent about an hour in the park. a beautiful location to be and spend time. Not suited for senior citizens , but they can actually stroll across the garden. Wished we had some more time to take in the complete surroundings and serenity . The view point to the hills was good

title: Waste of time
review: Went there with friends, all you get there is cool breeze running through the rocks which becomes chilly and you can feel it. Good only in summer, area is not properly clean. Its tough to climb, not recommended for old people.

title: Very nice place to visit.
review: A must visit place. Wonder fully designed set of 6 caves. Among woods or forest garden. A new person will be afraid to go inside. Thin path, rocks, stone, dark, wet.. all possible combination. The path of forest too is confusing like Bhubhuliya.. but enjoyable. You will enjoy more if it rains.

title: Unexpectedly Wonderfull
review: WOW! this was our reaction when we entered the place. What a place. One of the unexpected place. Very well maintained. Eco cave is more of an adventure cave. There are many caves within. Each cave had an entry and exit point. We need to find the exit by walk or crawl, yes i said Crawl. It was amazing experience. Crawling to get out of the cave, jumping & hopping the stones. We even need to go through small small gaps. 1 or 2 caves were very difficult to finish, we did skipped 1 or 2 caves.

title: Caves in the mountains
review: This place has 8 caves under various names. One can travel from one to the other. The path is curvaceous and provides bit of an adventure. During rainy season it gets slippery and muddy

title: very risky
review: Not much to see. Its more for people who are in may be adventure sports or trekking. Please don't take elderly people or kids to this place or people who are bit overweight.

title: Adventurous
review: Good go for adventure seekers. Different caves with different difficulty level to explore. Not suitable to go with small kids but 6+ years children will definitely enjoy

title: Nothing special
review: I did not like this place personally. There are 5-6 caves, enter from one end and get out from other end. Only if you are crazy about caves, you can give it a try.

title: Must view thing in nainital
review: Excellent caves and a lot of fun to travel through these caves. Be sure to wear flotter as you may get wet and dirty.

title: a must do at nainital
review: a must do for all people physically fit. quite an adventure. gets slippery during rains. make sure to wear shoes and tight fit clothing. jeans are gonna get dirty!

title: Not so great
review: The caves are not that great. Its a OK place to visit. Small caves are there named after animals. Ticket prices are high compared to what one gets to see.

title: Best place to visit in nainital
review: This is the natural cave garden. 2 km from mall road. One of the rare attraction where you can go inside the narrow caves and experience the nature.

title: Good for those who have never seen a cave
review: The locals have converted this place into a small cave garden. Good for children as the can have a view how a cave looks like. Nothing much else.

title: Real cave like expereince
review: it is worth stepping into one of the caves with a brave heart and a flexible body, one needs to be vigilant and wear good shoes; kids would enjoy crawling, creeping inside these caves - panther cave, bat cave,

title: Great attraction
review: A very unique place, This place has over 7 to 8 caves. Difficulty level rises with every passing cave. You need to have to drive to complete all but this is good fun for kids and would recommend at least one going through a couple of caves. Try if you wish to have an adventure.

title: Natural caves with adventure activity
review: Full of adventure. 6 caves named after Wild animals. But it requires sporty mindset to cross these caves.

title: Highly recommended attraction
review: Located on the way to nainital, this is a major tourist attraction . It has got a variety of ancient self formed cave named by the names of animals... Very nice experience

title: Mild dose of adventure
review: Couple of mins walk inside the narrow Lane between the two mountains with calm ankle-length water flowing ending into a small 4feet waterfall.More adventurous ones can scale a bit further slippery stones.

title: Natural Caves of nainital
review: Eco cave are natural caves of nainital. there have 6 caves. this is situated in middle of this hill station. this cave garden is administrated by local government. here you can some activity like. bull ride and go one tree to another by cable.

title: Must visit for tourists
review: This place is a collection of naturally formed caves that are named on animals... very slippery during monsoon or rainy season but are really amazing ... highly recommend

title: Caving In
review: It is must visit adventure nearby nainital. You can visit various natural caves. walking through the caves with its up and downs is a small adventure ....You need a ticket to enter the caves....You can walk through various carpeted lanes

title: Recreational
review: It is nice place to visit with kids above 10 years. You also should be adventurous to encourage kids to explore. They are raw yet safe and exciting to be in there in all the 4/6 caves. I am 60 plus. I tried 3. Enjoyed but it is stressful for my age

title: Enjoyed the experience
review: If you are up for it this is a series of caves... With some changes they have made the caves with different levels of difficulty to traverse

title: Tiring
review: The places is a chain of caves & it can be too tiring to cover all the caves. Plus,the lighting inside these caves is poor. You have to be extremely careful while passing through these caves. If you're here to relax just skip it.

title: limestone mountains
review: cave r natural .. at some places they r doing some artificial stuffs but its for kids to have fun .. not caves in that sense

title: Ecstatic-Explore it and get amused
review: This is one of the great places to visit in Nainital. The caves ( total 6 in number) is breathtaking and offers great adventure as well as fun.The places also has a zipline, a garden and a restaurant. Some of the caves are very steep and requires climbing too ( not advisable for old people although if one is fit he can try).

title: adventure activity
review: one has to bend down low and twist oneself to get through these caves. they are safe however. a bull ride is thrown in for those who want to try it.

title: A unique place. Visit early morning to avoid crowd
review: The park has lot of caves. One has to literally crawl inside to reach to the bottom. Do mind your step, to avoid getting hurt. Do visit early in the morning to avoid crowd

title: Adventures garden
review: It has some very good caves.

title: Amazing
review: Slightly away(1km) from the hustling n bustling of the Mall road are located these wonderous caves. Fun for children, childhood nostalgia for grown-ups. Its a must see whenever in Nainital

title: Real Caves where you can move around
review: It is a real cave where you can roam around in different caves. Weather is naturaly cool inside and overall nice experience.

title: A unique place to surprise you
review: If you have kids or not averse to to little physical movement then you  must visit the place. There are cave of different sizes named after different animal, like in tiger cave one has to bend his/her back or crawl like a tiger to cover from entry to exit of the cave. It is difficult for a tall person to go through entire caves unless and until extremely physically fit. Overall good fun

title: Adventurous
review: I was not expecting much from the place. It also carried a entry ticket so we didn't want to waste our money for nothing. But we decided to go in. From the entrance itself you get a vibe of a forest. There are caves at different directions with different name for each cave. The experience inside each cave was amazing. A cave or two were so narrow that people were returning from the entrance only. But it was fun experience. Not sure if they ate human made caves but they really looked real. The caves very much reminded me of ardhkwari in vaishno devi temple. Don't miss this if you r in a tour to nainital. Parking is available and there is a food court also inside it.

title: Adventure
review: If you want adventure this is the place for you. There are total 6 caves where in tiger and leopard cave is easier. Natural caves have been restructured for tourist with steps. Remaining four are bit difficult but kids will enjoy the same. It will take 1 to 2 hour depending on tourist. There is a restaurant and fountain within location.

title: Must go for this caves
review: My kids enjoyed this cave garden and entered in 4 sections of caves. Narrow passage made it feel like adventurous.

title: Place worth going...we all enjoyed a lot esp. my kids....spare 1-2 hours for the same...not too far from the main city.
review: Since I had planned Nainital tour, I was unclear weather this place is worth visiting or not. I did not have adequate information; whatever I had was from seeing reviews on trip advisor website.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Worth a visit. The bat's cave and the Ape's cave were really challenging. Not recommended for old people.

title: Nice to visit, must go
review: Must visit nice place to visit. Do not take small kids along as some of the caves are very narrow and it’s difficult to went through. Must wear sport outfit.

title: Adventures
review: Best place to experience caves as this place have natural caves and you will loose your fear of caves.

title: Ideal place was kids and tourists looking for a new attraction apart from the normal hotspots!!
review: Very well maintained. How the caves have been labelled and provided  access with is admirable work by the management. The view from the place as well is something not to be missed. Any age group would love it equally, it is quite fascinating, knowledgable and adventurous at the same time!! Only needed add on would be some washrooms and better transport facilities to the place!!

title: Cave garden with eco sound
review: This eco cave garden have a unique p,ace to visit ,there is a entry ticket of rs 25 for adults and 10 for childrens

title: Great Experience
review: There is 3-4 cave inside the cave garden.  It was great and very hard experience going through the caves

title: Old Caves - Kids can enjoy
review: There are around 5-6 caves in which one can go in and come out from the other end. Kids will definitely enjoy here. You may skip few of the caves as most of them are same. Be careful while walking inside the caves. There is a nominal charges for entry i.e. 40rs.

title: Love this place
review: The caves are very good and adventurous. There are around 10 caves one after the other. A must visit place

title: Must visit in Nainital
review: A very different place from the usual viewpoints and lakes which we generally see in hill stations.

title: Waste of time
review: It's just a garden with some caves. You can't go more than a few feet inside the caves since the openings are very narrow. Can be avoided easily. Only good thing I felt was there is good scope for some photography there.

title: Top attraction for me in Nainital
review: If you are couple or young or teenager and you like adventurer/Trekking then this is no 1 place for you in Nainital. There is 6 different caves in this garden and from every cave you can exit if you don't want to continue for further cave. Also you can do small cable gliding near exit.

title: Good Adventurous activity.
review: Place is a must visit. But only for the brave hearts. Again like every place in Nainital all the way uphill. Do not go in alone especially panther cave. But nice for a good adrelain rush.

title: Very nice
review: Nice place for and grown ups alike. Many caves in name of animals are fantastically organised for an adventurous passage through the caves and like a nature park. A must visit without doubt.

title: Ordinary
review: Nothing to get special attraction..all caves seem to be same...we returned after walkibg through 2 caves

title: A must go !!
review: Very nice garden with some lovely natural caves. Very nice layout. Be prepared to crawl and wiggle your way through some of the narrow caves....very different and worth seeing....

title: Must Visit
review: Entry fees to be paid but enjoyable with family and friends.

title: For Slims
review: This place is really good, you can see old caves of various types, but you need to be slim to enjoy all this, and be careful while visiting these caves

title: Had good Fun at Eco Cave Gardens
review: Exciting Place.This place is a very beautiful place to wander, anyone ranging from a child to grown-up can come here.

title: Beautiful Place Eco Cave Gardens
review: Visited Eco caves gardens in the morning. This place is a very beautiful place to wander, anyone ranging from a child to grown-up can come here. There are some nice caves, which start from a very low difficulty level to some tough one's, but surely they are amazing.

title: CAVES IN MOUNTAINS
review: nice place for a excursion.maintainance is ok.ggod for any age group.some rides are also available.ok

title: Different fun activities for kids
review: I enjoyed all the caves with my daughter. You need to be agile to get through. Kids would definitely enjoy it. Ticket is something like Rs 20.

title: Good for kids
review: Good adventurous for kids. You have options to skip a cave . There are 4-5 caves where one can go in and come out . A good exercise for your body.

title: Waste of time
review: It is nothing, just few rocks which are maintained by the local folks out there.. Kids may fall.. careful with your mobile because when i was there peoples were searching there mobiles which were accidentally dropped and fall into caves.

title: Experiencing ancient Caves in a small duration
review: These are 5-6 natural and man-made caves are to be experienced. Few caves are very easy to go through where as difficult level is high for some. Cemented steps are given for access to in and out of the caves

title: Not a must visit place for tall and fat ppl
review: Last week we visited Eco cave gardens . It’s not a recommended place for tall , fat and pregnant ladies ...

title: Dangerous Cave
review: Eco Cave Gardens situated at Kaladungi area of Nainital.Five to six caves are here but all are dangerous.No safety and precaution to be there and specially risky for women and child.Otherwise this parks is good scenic beauty and attractive.

title: a must visit
review: I visited this place with my family, and explored all caves. It was nice experience to explore natural caves.

title: Impressive and fun
review: We visited this place with very less expectations but I found the caves there really interesting

title: Nice get away
review: Though nothing grand in my opinion, I found the Eco Cave Gardens to be a relaxing stop as it was on my way.

title: Wow... Nature at its best...
review: So let me tell you the most important points first :

title: Nice cave!!!
review: Eco cave garden is a very nice and interesting place to visit at it.  There are lots of caves to visit.

title: small cave
review: Small cave of old stones, fat person can't go there because cave doesn't have enough space to enter. you can see the best views for pictures from the top. and there is cafe available where you can take coffee snacks. and its little bit costly because its charges are 64 INR. and it's also difficult to give 64 INR because of money change issues.

title: Excellent place
review: There are some nice caves,which start from a very low difficulty level to some tough one's,but surely they are amazing.This place is a very beautiful.

title: High priced..
review: The entry fee is Rs. 60

title: Adventurous, refreshing
review: Ticket is required to get inside the caves. Counter opens at 10AM. Adventurous but tiring as at times need to crawl, sit, lay down and then crawl again to move inside the caves. However there is enough natural light, at some places they have got bulbs which makes it easier to move inside the caves. They have a garden with a fountain in middle at the top with food joints to get you relaxed. The BAT AND APE caves are bit difficult as you have to lay down flat and then crawl in order to move and jump on the boulders which you get across in APE cave.

title: Boring experience!
review: I went to this location early in the morning. These 5 caves are replicas of animals that dwell in them. Some of the caves are very narrow so it gets congested to enter in it. Hence be very careful when you try this activity. The whole area is surrounded by greenery. There is a musical fountain that happens here in the evening. Overall this activity is not a must visit.

title: Do visit if you are in Nainital!
review: Do visit this place. Great place for some activities. Would get tired by sliding through small gaps between rocks and caves. Would get tired in doing so, but it's well worth it.

title: Holiday
review: It's an artificial caves.made only for exicitment.  Within the city. Just for time pass and resting. Not advisable to visit

title: Must visit
review: It is very good family outing. It requires physical effort to cover all caves as you need to crawl and climb as required.

title: Beautiful Place
review: Well maintained & one of the best place to visit in Nainital. Cross different types of caves was a memorable experience

title: This place was amazing
review: Eco cave gardens on the most existing place Nainital. Different types of caves are there some like horror and some adventures.

title: A nice place to or a different place
review: this takes you to 4 to 5 caves which are different in sizes and name.. while you feel adventure .. kids may like it .. old age and very small kids should avoid the place

title: Denger
review: Wonderful cave at the nainital it is near the high court. Ticket is 64 rs. Its too risky but enjoyble also.

title: excellent place to visit
review: It's really a very nice place for the people looking for adventure.The caves are really natural and feeling thrilled to explore it all.

title: Great experience of caves
review: It has 4-5 caves, which provide an amazing earthy experience, Try for Bat caves, its one of the best experience you will ever have.

title: Must visit place in Nainital
review: You have to add this place in your Nainital  local sight seen places. Full paisa vassal point...  Must visit..  We have enjoy this place very much..

title: Adventureous
review: Good place with different caves and you have to go through them crawling and in the last cave you have to show some rock climbing skills as well.

title: A must if you are visiting Nainital
review: It is a really fun place. The caves are exciting and even in summers it is cold inside the caves. A must do with cousins or friends.

title: Worst
review: Waste of time....its a place where you pay entry ticket and get back pain and with kids it very difficult to explore caves so better to avoid

title: Vacation Trip
review: Nothing big or attractive to describe about this cave after seeing so many huge and large caves in South Africa. This is very small one and can be covered in 10 mins.    You can also skip this site, if your schedule doesn't have time.

title: Natural caves just near to Nainital lake
review: These caves are are beautiful narural caves, just 20 min walking distance from Mallital. You can spend 2 hours here. Caves  are cold even in June month and water is also dripping at many places. Not fit for kids below 10 year and elderly persons. There are some rides also available at the cave gardens. A new visitor in Nainital must enjoy the walk in these caves.

title: Adventures Caves
review: Booked an Alto in rs 700 for Nainital Darshan on 10th Sept 2017 from the Mall Road. Our first point of Nainital Darshan was Cave Garden. Caves are Adventures. It's tough to pass through the caves if you are carrying a baby. Some parts of the caves were slippery.

title: Exciting place to visit
review: Great caves. We were really excited to travel through the caves. inside the cave Rock was too chill and  a bit slippery. Shoes would be highly recommended. Those were real caves where the tiger, cheetahs used to stay. a sort of trekking like experience but for only few min. after visiting all the caves there is a view point inside the garden, where you will have a good view of nainital. Few water and rope activities are available inside. Strictly no parking available nearby

title: interesting
review: lovely place a must visit for all tourists but not for the elderly.

title: Good cave to visit in Nainital
review: The cave is situated near Sukhatal. We had visited in the morning. This place has caves like, tiger cave, panther cave, ape cave, bat cave, etc. It is advisible for elder people to go inside the cave, as the steps are very steep. Also, there are some adventurous activities, games which can be enjoyed.

title: Great place for the enthusiast
review: You can spend an evening here and engage in activities - they have different caves with different difficulty levels.

title: Adventurous
review: We visited eco cave garden in may , awesome place it is.Not for old age people at all.Its entry ticket is of nominal charges.You can enjoy bull ride inside. Lot of caves are there like panther cave, tiger cave etc.There is a maggie point inside the garden there u get different maggie , paranthas, juices etc.view is awesome from maggie point.

title: Unique experience!
review: Adventurous site. Beautiful view of the city and surrounding hills from the top. Exciting caves. Lots of spots to click beautiful pictures. A must visit place.

title: Adventurous !! but not for everyone
review: The place has multiple natural and artificially created caves. Visitors are supposed to pass through them. In a  few places it is bit cramped up and one has to literally slide through a few places. It is a unique experience in itself. It is lighted enough from inside.

title: Caves with unwanted mystery
review: The place have few caves created naturally n fixed manually. Visitors are asked to pass through these caves for entry to exit. Just a mystery created for a adventure ride otherwise nothing noticeable.

title: Good place to visit in Nainitaal
review: Nice place and risky caves; if you want adventure of passing through a ghost cave, visit here. But be safe and pass through caves very cautiously as if you slip, you may be wounded.Except to cave it is just a nice botanical garden, not very waste in size but ok. As it is inside city of nainital you can easily visit there. Dont pass through cave with child in lap. you have to buy ticket here on arrival.

title: An amazing place for Kids and Adults
review: I visited Cave Garden along with my family and kids. I was initially unsure of what it could be. But when we reached, we were surprised to see the caves that were so exciting to pass through. The kids wanted to move through them again and again. The caves were cold as ice and the whole place is full of greenery.

title: Short experience
review: Not ideal for the claustrophobic. But for those people there are other areas inside with views of the peaks and the city below, and a garden.

title: Caves with daring sprit at Nainital
review: Caves garden is very much located in sukhatal, earlier this sukatal was having plenty of water however because of land sliding the lake got dry hence called sukatal, these caves are formed because of water srink out of these and made a path so tourist follows these path and enjoy by sliding under rock over to them.

title: Nice Place to spend some time here.
review: This is a good place to spend some 2 hours of quality time inside the caves which remind you of ancient caves in some of the traditional areas of India. There are options of some adventure activities as well such as Bull Ride, Columbus, Flying Fox etc.

title: Ok Ok experience
review: Definitely not a place to visit with aged people. Small kids will also find it very difficult to explore the caves. Walking around the park/garden was ok.

title: very good place
review: A must visit place on Nainital trip  it will take approx. 1 hour to visit , old people with knee and back problem and people with very small childern should avoid it. caves are natural and very cool from inside over all a good place

title: Good Caves
review: This place is a small park but is good to see. The caves are somewhere quite small and an adventure lover will always like it.

title: Good for thin or medium body people
review: If you are fatty person, then must avoid this place, otherwise must go. It has 4 caves and they are coonected with each other by walking route. It is adventurous to go in cave garden but one thing that you should keep in mind that you must take care of your head, otherwise mild to moderate injury may occur if you will go carelessly. Overall place was good.

title: Waste of time
review: It was overcrowded and not really a cave of sorts. It is just an opening between huge rocks where you can walk through. It was probably created in 1800s when the mountain top fell over naintal lake.

title: Only for the children and fit people
review: Eco Caves is a nice place to visit if you have children or if you like some adventure. There are 5-6 caves in all, some pretty difficult to access. Overweight people should probably avoid some of the caves. Apart from the caves, there is nothing else to enjoy. So if you are short of time, may avoid this spot.

title: Unique experience
review: Steep caves of tiger and panther. Good experience. Good effort by KMVN. However difficult to negotiate in certain areas....esp for elderly.

title: CAVES ---Feel them  - a must....
review: I suppose it is a very new placed added in the tourist circuit

title: simply love such thing
review: Whatever you say, but i simply love it. I have been here thrice. The only worthful place which i feel where those driver take among their 11 view points. Its not have much adventure but its good for small fun, especially when you are on college trip. Not for old and kids.

title: Natural caves
review: You get experience of passing through various caves here. It challenges your physical fitness to some extent.

title: Good experience for Kids
review: There are around 6 natural, Eco caves which gives good experience for the kids to go through them. For elders they will have to mind their heads and also take care as few caves have difficult and narrow passage. Otherwise nothing much to look at this place.

title: Not a must...
review: Charges₹50/adult,₹20/child.has 4-5 artificial caves.visited when there was a light shower,sowas a bit slippery and muddy.nothin more special.should visit  only if have spare time or u are exceeding adventurous,not recommended otherwise

title: Good Place to visit from Nainital
review: This is a good place to visit while taking a day trip from Nainital. Place is good, natural hide out for leopards and tigers are displayed in a natural cave. Only difficulty you may face, if you have a person with bulky figure in your team, then that may cause a problem for you.

title: Its ok
review: It's meant for the physically fit ones. Me and wife stopped after seeing 2 caves. Kids explored all. Have to go thru lot of cramped spaces. Obese people pl avoid.

title: Good experience
review: It is a good experience while going through the panther and tiger caves. Worth visiting once. Good experience

title: Cave
review: A must visit for physically fit people.

title: Good concept
review: The concept of eco caves good challenging trip inside the caves. I have told the authorities to update the website to reflect the correct price of adult tickets.  Need to maintain cleanliness there.

title: Adventurous Spot
review: A must visit place on Nainital trip and I can bet you would cherish your visit in this cave garden. Stones are cold and make you feel adventurous.

title: Love the different cave structures and a must a visit
review: It has several caves like tiger cave, lion cave, ape cave, flying fox cave, porcupine cave etc. It was a lot of fun covering each and every cave. Youngsters will love it

title: Good for kids.
review: Some caves to go down and up. Kids enjoyed Flying fox jump for only 50 bucks. Bit tiring for all places but a nice place n must go

title: great place
review: must see place when you visit nanital, it will take around 1 hour to visit , old people with knee and back problem and people with very small childern should avoid it.

title: Nice little adventure on a beautiful hill station
review: Situated quite near to the Mall road, its a must visit place. Old aged people should avoid it. Though, crossing all these caves was fun but the best part was that even with soo much of crowd the place was clean outside and inside.

title: Nice and a bit different place
review: We covered this as a part of local sightseeing in Nainital. There were multitude of caves which we felt it to be somewhat adventurous ( in not very literal terms ). The place offers a feel of rustic forests with those caves. Lot of Photographic opportunities with such backgrounds are present.

title: A different concept
review: One should visit it if one is in Nainital. I have never been to this type of garden. It is adventurous. However, one can go inside the caves only if one is not scared going inside the caves.

title: Good for Nothing - Eco Cave Gardens
review: Nainital is a small city and every historic or tourist places are very close to each other or you can say that with in a maximum radius of 8 kms everything is covered.

title: Very good and unique place for Children and family
review: One of the most adventurous place in Mountains. Enjoy the Caves though take precautions and save your head while visiting the caves.

title: Great under-earth experience
review: This is an unique place to visit in Nainital. It has six caves through which visitors can pass. Each cave has own exit route which you can choose if you do not want to proceed further in next caves. First two caves are easy to explore, from next cave difficulty level increases. But it is up to the individuals whether they want to proceed further or not. It is a great experience inside the caves. Also, it is so cold inside that you will feel like you are sitting in an A.C. room. The dark places in the caves are illuminated using bulbs so ther will be no problem of light. Also, since these are natural caves hence there are sections which are illuminated naturally (by sunlight). Overall, it is a must visit place.

title: enjoyable and thrilling caves
review: the garden is located on the hills of nainital and have different caves with different names. you can enjoy the feel of entering and passing through deep and steep caves. nothing more is there in the garden

title: Not a very attractive place
review: We mistook as Zoo and went to find only it is a cave garden. It is just a place to roam around to just see some caves (not very sure whether ever tiger or panther lived in those caves). However, those who are inquisitive of knowing about how the caves look can visit this place.

title: Some thing different in nainital
review: Good cold natural caves, something different to do in nainital, we visited first two caves tiger and panther, both are easy to walk, just take care of your head, guard told in other caves you have to crawl so we did not visit. Good site for photography

title: Exciting experience
review: This was so much fun for us as well as kids.. There are 6 caves and getting in and out was a task but super fun... We are thrilled with this one

title: Amazing experience!
review: One of it's types. For all of you who are confused by it's name. Eco cave garden isn't a garden at all. These are actual caves. A beautiful place to visit. A place trekkers would really love to visit. These are caves of six different animals. i.e. Bat, Dlying Fox, Porcupine, Panter, Tiger and Ape. It's a must visit place guy's. Do visit.

title: Adventorous experience through caves
review: We saw around 6 caves in this garden. Each one has a different difficulty level. In some spots, you need to crawl through. Caves were well lit and clearly marked.

title: Very Well Maintained
review: This place is very well maintained by the government officials and is not very famous among travellers

title: Nice to go there and roam around the caves .
review: Nice place but accompany your Kids while roaming in the caves , Great to get some adventures inside the caves

title: Lovely little caves
review: While visiting Nainital, this place should be covered as it's a little different kind of attraction.

title: Loved it!!
review: It was lovely visiting these caves.  we really enjoyed.  it was very adventurous.  Kidz enjoyed a lot visiting these caves.

title: Something New and Exciting
review: The Caves are really narrow and you must watch your head otherwise BANG. It is great fun for Kids as well as Adults.

title: Adventurous
review: Adventure...... is the first word comes to mind when you visit this place..... multiple small caves... good place to visit if you wish to try some adventurous activity......

title: Interesting Natural Caves in Nainital
review: The place has about 5-6 different type of natural caves, some of them are an adventure to visit and pass thru and are very long ones too. It looks like homes of animals but very interesting to pass and view them from inside. Worth a visit.

title: Good for children only
review: I personally feel there isn't much to visit in Eco Cave Gardens. There are some narrow caves to pass by. That's it! But if you have children in your group they'll enjoy. Passing through those narrow caves can be quite tedious for elderly.

title: Nice place
review: This garden is very good and very silent place. There were very good mark put on the way so nobody confuse in this garden. There are all types of facility available. There eco voice very clearly listen. You must be visit there.

title: stupid place
review: We drove long distance to see the Eco Cave Gardens expecting a peaceful place with a garden. It is terrible to see nothing but a few trees which are almost dead. On the entrance there are more vendors of maggi noodles than the trees inside the garden

title: Fun for both kids & adults.
review: This garden has some naturally formed caves which are fun to traverse. It's just a short walk in town to reach and worth the time. Some of the caves are not for people who are too obese.

title: You can Feel some Original Caves
review: Place having 3-4 natural caves, where you can roam inside caves and feel how it's looks like for those who still live in caves.

title: Watch your head and where you step
review: A trip tot he eco caves requires you to be adventurous. Watch where you walk as the path is narrow and very uneven at a lot of the places (they are caves after all).

title: excellent cave visit
review: The ticket is priced INR 50/- You can easily visit the Tiger cave and if you are old better to avoid cave entrance.  Panther Cave is really thrilling.  Fort youngsters it will be adventurous.  Please avoid BULL RIDE as it is not worth it.  It is just like any other game and the bull is operated electrically and falls and getting up for youngsters will be good.

title: Thrill and excitement to explore unknown territories
review: It excites me every time I visited. The caves are good to explore. It is thrilling when you don't see the end of the tunnel and wish you can go back. The have bull ride here a fun for children. Good 1 hour visit.

title: Splendid place
review: Surprisingly a very nice place.

title: Full of Trill and adventurous
review: Must visit place for adventure lovers. Full of thrill. You just cant find a next turn unless you reach to the point. It is thrilling but safe too. Kids will enjoy alot. I wrnt with 8yrd daughter... and there was a snowfall outside. Ee enjoyed alot..

title: Test your agility skills
review: A very nice concept park in Nainital where healthy adults and children can explore caves made on various animal names such as panther cave, tiger cave, bats cave etc. One has to climb up and climb down inside a cave and manouvre himself/herself as per the rigid route and come out of it. One has to turn and twist his/her body in many dimensions to make his/her way out. A good experience! Go for it

title: Average caves
review: eco cave is ok ok side seen its not good for all age parson Some caves are scary and very secluded..its ok ok

title: very well designed, and gives you an experience of going through caves
review: If you are in nainital, you should definitely try this, they have about 6/7 different cave trails and all are designed uniquely, probably as the name suggest: bat cave, porcupine, tiger, ape, etc... You should be open for some adventure if you visit this place, the caves could be tough as you need to crawl under and climb over to get through.. The fox flying is also an attraction...

title: Amazing place to visit
review: Enjoy exploring the Caves and the Greeny all over the places and the view is awesome you can look the mountains

title: Interesting new adventure small and dangerous, which is good!
review: If you are an adventure loving person and seeking new adventure, its a good place for you. But be carefull, the place is a bit cozy. It became more interesting when rain and snow hit nainital. Well interesting to me might be dangerous to you. So be cacious and don't wear normal sneakers. Put on some shoes with great grip. I personally prefer my thick and grippy soled boots.

title: NICE ECO CAVE GARDENS
review: The caves are very nice and eye catching. Nice for younger people to visit and explore the caves. The pathway is difficult to walk in these caves.

title: Amazing View
review: loved the view from the garden as I was simply amazed the time I came inside the garden the view from there of hills is the USP of Nainital

title: Beautiful but not for all
review: Visited in Nov 2016 though greenery is everywhere but i felt bore and better to spend time in n around lake or snow point,aged people n suffering from joint pains can not go through caves n much difficult

title: Unique Place
review: Caves are artificially made going down and up in cave is some what risky. But can visit one time. Entry fees is there. cameras allowed

title: Eco cave gardens
review: The place is very quiet and lonely despite being very amazing. It offers you to experience caves which are built naturally. The caves are very cold inside and one need tonne watchful. People with breathing issues should avoid. The caves are mesmerising and a must visit. There is an entry ticket of Rs. 50 and it is advisable if people with any joint pain issues to avoid this cave visit. You need to walk on bigger steps in a stair case and though it is very easy but may trouble you if you have fear for dungeon places. I enjoyed it very much.

title: Nice experience
review: Try this place only you are agile... flexible ... and not frightened of getting into small crawling caves ...

title: Beautiful natural caves....
review: Eco cave gardens are located very near to the main nainital city towards the kalidungi highway... These are beautiful natural caves where you can enjoy and relish the nature.. Very appropriate for kids and family.... Entry fees is very nominal and is worth paying... Highly recommended...

title: One of the best places in Nainital
review: It's a series of caves through which you have go through. It's tight and a little challenging at some places. But a person with average fitness can do it.

title: You'll love the greenery there
review: Since we had stayed in Hotel Rio Grand, the nearest attraction to us was Cave Gardens. In fact, we could have a view of the Garden from the hotel itself. This was our first attraction and we really liked the highly maintained 'green' garden. Again really good for kids.

title: must visit for kids
review: there are multiple caves one leading to another with the paths adventurous for kids but can be challenging for old people .

title: Natural Cave
review: We have first hand experience of natural Cave.  It was a great experience and wonder full way to see the natural cave. While we where enjoying the cave there started a snow fall and it was great to see that

title: Little bit thrilling experience
review: Eco caves r gud for one time visit. one is tiger & second is panther cave. vry tite way to cross the caves. one must hv vry careful during passing th caves. lack of carefulness can harm u physically. shoes without heels r recommended....lack of cleanliness

title: The name says it all its all about caves.
review: It is quite easy to reach this place as this is one of the tourist place to which transportation is not a problem at all and coming to caves the entry ticket is Rs.50 PP and there are 5 caves in total. 1st cave would be Tiger cave where you will enter and the Apes cave is the last cave where you exit however if you feel to come out of any cave you can exit from that particular cave as they have separate exists. However there is nothing much than the caves here so its best to complete all of them as there some very narrow passages which are quite difficult to pass through. Apart from caves there are some activities and games for children so i think 30 to 45 mins is enough for this place.

title: An adventurous garden
review: A must-do. Some of the caves like the Ape's Cave can be challenging. In some places you literally have to crawl. Claustrophobic individuals will find it difficult. But if you have an adventurous vein, you will be delighted.

title: A good view point
review: It is a good view point at top but also one among many in the hill station. The narrow caves that take you to it provide some excitement but that is more for children.

title: Nothing great
review: If you like crawling and squeezing through caves, you might enjoy this place, else there is nothing much to do here. Not advisable at all for senior citizens.

title: Ok Place
review: Stairs are very Dangerous specially in Rain and Snow.  No Guide in Cave,Good for Photography. Nice view,

title: Not much of interest for me
review: Cheap to enter. The caves were ok but I didn't fancy going through the narrow ones anyway. A few tacky attractions like bucking bull ride and not much else to be honest. Seems run down

title: not so ineresting
review: this is well maintained park with natural caves and you can stroll and spend time. but nothing new or great in it

title: Eco cave
review: Firstly done go if senior citizen are there but yes adventures if you are couple and kids with you they will simply love it.

title: Ancient Caves
review: Nyc palce to visit when you are in Nanital.

title: Cool Experience and a good physical exercise
review: Good experience of walking through (and at times crawling through) a cave. The cave interiors were quite cold.

title: Must one time visit
review: Very good for kids and adults

title: In the Den
review: An exciting place to visit , walking through caves where wild animals prowled. We had to bend double to go through the caves.

title: Mini adventure experience
review: Good walk in the caves. Naturally created, some places to walk down and some places to creep through. There are multiple caves worth a visit. Do carry a torch / phone torch for your guidance. Safe place to visit and some caves can be covered by kids as well.

title: Awesome place
review: natural caves , nice to go around, but some of them not suitable for old people. it requires 2 hours to go thru the whole place.

title: Too good but....
review: The cave garden is too good. We had been to this garden with our 2 year old daughter. We found it extremely difficult and dangerous to carry her through the cave. We couldn't make it to finishing point. I advise parents of babies and toddlers to think twice before entering the cave. For all others, enjoy the adventure !!

title: Good for young people
review: I personally loved it.. it was fun.. ppl hav to go from one point to another through caves.. nt suitable for old age ppl n heavy ppl.

title: Good for kids !!
review: There are two caves, one which is dark and deep, you need to use ropes to enter into cave. This is bit risky and not advised for elder people. Other cave is long and deep but there is enough support to go from one point to other. For kids who have seen caves in the TV and read in books this is good expereince.

title: Case Gardens
review: highlight of the trip Fun activity, please make sure you are not scared of dark places, rather than going to different points. try this place

title: Horror but really good
review: Caves are little bit horror ,but really good experience ...if you have capacity to do the exercises go ahead ...this location is only for you..

title: Not for the faint hearted and unfit people
review: A lovely place that has gone to seed like most Indian tourist places - The fountains were dry - the paths were unkempt with no proper directions in the caves - 2 women were sitting outside and frightening all those who wished to attempt going into the caves - As i was all alone and there were no proper signages or adequate lights I only attempted one If one loves climbing up and down steps and uneven paths this is an ideal place to enjoy How I wish it were better maintained and made a real natural beauty to behold.

title: caves
review: The caves are dark and little horror. If climbing and going tostairs and experiencing the dark caves is your interest then it is a must go. Also if you have stamina to walk and climb more then only go.

title: Must Visit
review: Eco Cave Garden is a cluster of interconnected caves and hanging gardens.There are six underground caves in this garden,connected through tunnels.Migratory birds can also be seen here.

title: Adventurious Joy.
review: It is among the sight seeing tour. or one can visit personally walking to cave garden from Mall road. Major attraction is Bull Ride. No one could do it as the bull manages to get rid of the rider on it.Further there are 2 rock caves on  left and right. one way enter and manage to come out other way.People with breathing troubles advised not to enter the caves The Garden is fully covered with plants bushes and trees. even dark at day time. caves are provided light bulbs.. .

title: Awesome !!
review: Eco Cave garden is part of the Himalayan Botanical Gardens which is made of 6 caves tiger, panther, monkey, porcupine etc. Each with a distinct characteristic replicating the animal it represents. I am not much of a adventure seeker or walker however I really enjoyed myself and it's not very taxing on any person. It's a must visit.

title: The place where animals actually inhabited.
review: Its a must visit place in nainital. It is just next to the only petrol pump of nainital. The place has natural caves once inhabited by animals like tiger, panther, apes etc. Old age, asthmatic, heart patients should avoid the place, as it becomes narrow at some place and have climb the rocks.

title: A must visit
review: A modern make man made cave with a natural look, Its really a thrilling experience and maximum people dare to go in BAT Cave, Loved it.

title: Animal Caves
review: The caves are said to be house of animals and they are slightly modified so that humans can see them. It is one of its kind experience to go into the caves and come out from other end twisting yourself here and there as at some points they are too narrow or too low to even sit. It is not good for kids.

title: Beautiful caves
review: Me and my kids enjoyed the eco caves experience. Some caves were really risky, but the boys enjoyed a lot. We enjoyed the ropeway also.

title: Cave Fun!!!
review: Average Experience. One enters from one side and comes out from other. Neeed to bend and twist a little every time.

title: Kids enjoyed it
review: We have visited this place in October 2016 with my granddaughter and grandson.They have thoroughly enjoyed the place and have fun.

title: Different & adventurous
review: It's such a unique place that you are bound to get excited. It has several different caves of decreasing dimensions which you need to pass. Moderate difficulty level and strictly not for elders.

title: A surprise at every turn
review: adventurous short trek with careful steps from one natural cave to another but in some caves you really have to crawl and climb

title: Waste of money and time
review: Out of town on kaldhungi road.entry and parking is expensive.good only for school children between 12-16.better to spend time on lake

title: Good Cave experience
review: There is a bat cave that is dark and scary, but you will have to crawl all the way down, use the ropes for support. There is a Panther cave as well.

title: Visit only if you havr surplus time
review: Only 2 caves were open. Clothes get dirty in rainy season. I have seen better caves like the ones in meghalaya

title: Exceptional outing
review: Before visiting, I was imagining it as a garden with small cave. But I was wrong and happy. Variety of caves, both natural and man made with different difficulty levels that can entertain a wide range of people who wish to experience something exceptional. Highly recommended.

title: Not at all recommended
review: - The Eco-cave garden is not at all maintained and most of the caves are cosed for the public. I could see only one cave which has access from entry to exit.

title: natural suurounding
review: Well done / maintained. Does not seem as if is in a busy place. Caves can be a bit scary. Need to walk carefully due to terrian

title: Adventure#Children#Favourite
review: Planning to go to Nainital , make sure u dont miss  taking your kids to Eco cave garden.   Passing through narrow, dark , dingy caves makes  you feel scary, adventurous  n exciting at the same time.

title: Good
review: Ok. Nice experience. Proper hilly cave. 2 types of caves. Panther cave is too thin. It's nice to visit once.

title: Lovely place
review: It's a beautiful place to spend an hour or so. They have buit caves of different animals. Do mind your head while passing through caves.

title: Really intersting and worth visiting...
review: These caves are not stalactite and stalagmite caves ... these are simply caves... and pretty interesting but not dangerous. But in some places, these openings and the interior path of the caves are really complex and difficult for a average build person to go through.

title: Not sure why??
review: The place is OK to go if you are on a long trip to Nainital. I would rather do boating twice. I don't know why they charge 50 bucks for that.

title: Waste of time
review: They have a small zip line . Except that just a few caves. I was surprised how could someone charge a ticket for such a place. Best avoided

title: Nature's interesting part
review: You can either go with family or friends.

title: Its an OK place to be...
review: Locals say a lot about this place...however, the caves do not stand tall to the claim. You can spend sometime here but nothing awesome.

title: A good time pass
review: Nainital has few places to capture your attention. This is one of them. It offers both adventure and peace. You can take a stroll around the gardens or you can navigate the caves. The 7 points tour is a sham, don't fall for it. Nainital Lake and gardens are the few better places in Nainital to explore.

title: Good way to keep the little ones interested
review: Interesting concept, and a fun activity for little kids. The caves are theme-based around different animals and some are pretty tough to navigate.You might have to crawl your way around. Could be better maintained though.

title: A place you must visit with kids
review: I was highly impressed the way Cave Garden is maintained. Though it was closed because of Rainy season, but entry was allowed and i could get access to two caves. One word of caution : Do not keep any loose things in your pockets.

title: monsoon obstacle
review: dont visit on rainy days ,caves become muddy .they dont allow to go inside ,peson wd asthma and hear problem definately think twice to visit there

title: Amazing Place
review: Sorry I am mis this place for have rain fall i am not see cave garde is closed for haveyy rain but i thing it is a amazing place i see this place next time visite in naini tal

title: this was nice view from the lake
review: sost of the love guys used to come here and spents some time together and enjyoes lot while having funs lot.

title: Nainital Visit
review: This is a must visit place in Nainital and is surely worth it. Be ready for some good adventure here and you need to go inside the caves. Not recommended for people who are fat and hefty as we need to really squeeze in inside the caves.

title: Adventure Spot on for Kids & Adults
review: Safe yet adventurous for video game spoiled kids and urban adults. A reprieve for those who lack out door activities and for those who spend their leisure in front of TV or shopping in malls. Please wear good sports shoes and jean or long trousers.

title: terrible wasting of time
review: out skirt of nainital and higly entry ticket of 50 each not worth to waste time rather spend time at maal road or do some boating

title: fun place for some safe rocking climbing
review: - highly recommend for children and young at heart, will thoroughly enjoy it

title: Must visit place
review: This place is really nice and can be enjoyed as an advanture. Some caves are really typical to pass through. When you will pass all caves you will say only thigh. It is worthy.

title: One time go
review: Don't stress if you can't make it. They are caves for fun, Kids will enjoy. Some of the caves you actually have to crawl through.

title: Naturally carved caves
review: We were told these were naturally carved caves that were very well maintained. A good activity on a bright day. Definitely avoid - Rainy days and elderly people since the caves require you to mould yourself from every angle before you can get in and come out :)

title: Good for nature lovers..bad for elderly person...
review: While moving from nainital to kilbury u come across ECO CAVE GARDEN... which is originally a modified form of natural caves that appeared to be useful as the tourist spot.

title: Nice activity for kids
review: Good enjoyment for kids. There are around 5-6 paths that go thru the caves.  A bit strenuous for elderly people

title: Not good for elder
review: Place has some fun activity but have curve place so elder can't step up easily. Also need some cleanness.

title: Fantastic
review: Eco cave garden turned out to be the surprise package in our trip to Nainital. There are multiple caves like, panther, bat etc. Couple of them are easy to complete however in few you would need to literally crawl. Physically taxing but real fun. Try if you are fit enough else you may end up straining a muscle or two.

title: An ecocaves  garden- needs better maintenance.
review: One of the popular tourist attractions of Nainital is the ecocave gardens consisting of a cluster of interconnecting caves and hanging gardens.  There are 6 caves  named after various animals. There are some musical fountains which work only at certain times.the  gardens need  better maintenance  to attract more tourists.

title: Nice concept
review: Well in a nutshell once in nainital this is a must visit as this park is unique and not commonly seen in all hill stations.

title: One of it's kind..must explore !!!
review: Kids are going to love it & so the adults...although not recommended for senior citizens.It's one of the it's kind due to the it's six long caves at one place...memorable moments esp with kids !!!

title: Cave Garden
review: The best times to visit Cave Gardens in Nainital are from March till June and then again in September-October. During these months the weather is pleasant enough to explore the outdoors.

title: Adventure dose
review: Kids really loved the caves and it was a unique experience for them and for the adults also. There are six caves in this particular area and it's very thrilling to go through the caves. It's a bit scary, but adventurous at the same time. Then there are other activities also like the flying fox and bull riding..but going into the caves is not for the weak hearted and old and obese people..

title: A good adventure place
review: Caves are really good place to try your skill to walk in a narrow, wet place. A great place for kids; my five year old daughter child loves tiget and percuppoine caves particularly. She thought it is an achievemen for her to complete that trail...it is great

title: Weird Place
review: I could not guess the place - it was totally opposite of its name.

title: Must go for adventure!
review: Nainital is a place that has much to offer for couple of days.

title: Truely amazing experience.
review: Though we could only visit 4 caves out of 7 as rest of the three caves were closed due to rain, we got thrill all around. After entering the caves , you will feel like being inside original caves . There are rain shades as well in case of sudden rain.

title: The only enjoyable thing
review: We enjoyed this to fullest... This is for experience as to what is feels like being in a cave or travelling though it. Most of the caves are inter connected & have an opening to come out with a distance of 5-7 mins.

title: Natural cave formations
review: The only thing I really enjoyed at Nainital was visiting these caves. The parking outside the caves is poor, but the caves are fun to visit..you can climb into caves and go through them..but some are steep enough so be cautious. Not recommended during rains since water clogs up in them.

title: Excellent
review: One of my best experiences in Nainital. Heavily recommended though old people may not be able to explore the caves.

title: its very cool inside caves
review: fresh cool air,like natural ac inside, its naturally made and may be some animal also stay inside in evening.

title: Interesting place to visit
review: This is comparatively newly built place in Nainital. This place provides unique experience to the visitors. Each cave is different and  not easy for everyone to pass through. It also has small eating point which provide basic stuff. Highly recommended if you are in Nainital.

title: Excellent with kids
review: There are about 4-5 real underground caves at this spot. It has been maintained well by the Govt. Only slim, active people and kids can go. Good fun.

title: Fun Place for Youngsters
review: It is a garden maintained in its natural beauty. The underground caves are well lit but difficult to traverse. There are very narrow passageways with steep steps. There is also a valley crossing activity in the campus. Not a place for senior citizens, though

title: For adventure lovers only!
review: It is a beautiful garden where all the activities are incorporated in the lap of nature itself. The caves were quite adventurous but they aren't recommended for overweight folks and old people. The kids went bananas here with exploring the cakes and they even had things like valley crossing and a mechanic bull (yup... we also felt that was a bit out of place but it was popular).

title: Adventure at economical price
review: I visited this place along with my friends in the month of March. I highly recommend this place as its fun to go not only with friends but also with family. Adventure at economical price

title: Great place
review: Good place for kids.

title: Amazing Place to Visit
review: Cave Gardens have 6 different caves from which you can pass and gather the experience of tracking and fun.It was an amazing experience out there.Caves are very cool.

title: Natural Caves: A little Danger More Fun
review: These are natural caves and this place is developed as a beautiful park. You can enjoy fountain in evening. A must visit place if you are on Nainital Trip.

title: Nice encounter with cave
review: Its a nice cave to be enjoyed.  Even though the climb is good for the family, people with back problems should avoid it.  The entire thing should not be rushed but should spend time and get a good feel of the cool inside the cave.  its good for the family and give many photo ops

title: Good for fun
review: This is also one of a sight seeing in nainital. You can enjoy Cave walk. Small activity like Rappelling. Enjoy Maggie. You can have a good time here. Very cheap tickets.

title: What a lovely place to be
review: The cave gardens actually highlight the way the animals used to live in there. A must place for every tourist to go. The best one is the cave which is for the lion

title: Natural caves of tiger and leopard.
review: Beautifully designed with natural caves of wild animal. During movement with-in caves you can do good photography and provides bull ride as well.

title: Cave Garden
review: It is very famous for its seven caves linked to each other. It is very beautiful place to visit. The entry fee is also very low.

title: A hole in the Hill
review: This is a typical point of visit created by the tour guides. Nothing more than a few holes on the side of the hill with ferns and moss growing. A waste of time.

title: Superb place
review: A cave with lots of adventure.....properly maintained ... Natural cave with beauty. complex is very clean & safe

title: Unquie place to see nature
review: One the unique place I had ever seen. Just scroll between caves, it think they are made artificially, Be cautious while moving.

title: Awesome place
review: Excellent nature place, few of the caves are awesome and it is fun for children's to experience where animals stay. You have to be careful with small children as few caves are steep.

title: Amazing
review: If you are adventure seeker, its a must visit. It has tricky caves and long enough to have thrilling experience. Its dark but bulbs are there to give you light.

title: Nice Place
review: It was a very nice place to visit. Caves are very deep and not advice heart patient, old age people to wait outside.

title: Amazing Place
review: there are total 5 caves. dazzling fox cave was half open and rest caves like Tiger cave , Panther cave, bat cave is really good. value for money place.

title: Probably the best place in Nainital
review: Went there last week. I found this place as one of the most exciting place in Nainital.

title: Adventure, Thrilling : Well worth it!!
review: Jumps, stretches, pulls, pushes, crawl and redemption. 50/- pp they have around 6 caves more you take more challenging it becomes not recommended for old, healthy and parents carrying babies because of the hurdles.

title: Claustrophobes beware of some corners here !!
review: A nice and natural small plot where, surprisingly, lots of visitors were walking around and appreciating. Something quite different and worth a short visit.

title: Good for children, adventure
review: The caves are fun to go through specially if you are with children.There are different types of caves for different animals.

title: average
review: nothing great about this place just has a few caves which are dingy & loud music being played for entertainment. An ok place for photos as well. they offer flying fox ride. Entry fee to eco cave is rs 50.

title: Amazziiiinggg
review: Totally worth it.. Initially did not keep any expectations for it but when  visitied this place, it gave an amazing experience.. A must must visit...

title: Must visit
review: It's really great adventure and thrill

title: Average visit to Eco Cave garden
review: There are basically five caves of various sizes with lot of difficulties for the traveller. Some adventure activities are there for all ages but not recommended for old peoples. It is not very thrilling inside.

title: Good Place
review: Nice, narrow caves - worth a 2-3 hour visit. 4-5 caves around. Quite crowded like all other places .

title: A different Experience
review: Surrounded by trees, the caves offers a novelty. Unfortunately there no display board with information regarding how the caves were formed, when they were discovered etc. There are 5 caves in all. As a septuagenarian I explored only the Tiger cave. Banged my head a few times, but that was OK. The other caves need you to crouch and crawl, which mu grand-kids happily did.

title: Good caves
review: This property houses 5-6 caves of which tiger cave is the most famous. If you are old, then you must avoid it as there are very narrow passages and sometimes you have to crawl inside the caves to get to the other end. It will not take much time to do all the caves. Be ready to get your hands and clothes slightly dirty as you crawl through. Therefore wear clothes accordingly. Most important mind your head always. Its a nice hangout place.

title: Loved it
review: Cave garden just offers you to crawl in the 5 caves which are full of thrill and entertainment. Each cave have its own specialty. One is for bats and other is for lion. I will say just go ahead.

title: must visit place
review: this is one of the attraction in nainital around five caves of different animals and the experience of going through the caves are really exciting.  it is really good for the young ones, not recommended for aged ones and small children

title: adventures
review: it was a fun to go there.

title: nice place
review: nice place to enjoy. family members and children can enjoy this place most. one of the best places of Nainital

title: Eco caves a must do
review: Must do when in Nainital. Great experience and gives you instant signals if your body is in good shape. Caution for those who are a bit over weight and have back or joint pains. Must wear proper shoes for this activity for good grip

title: Adventurous and fun !!
review: Eco caves are a natural system of 6 caves namely Tiger, Panther, Flying fox, Bat, Monkey and hyena.

title: Good for Adults. Must visit every cave
review: Good for Adults. Must visit every cave and at least once. Its remind you when you are playing with your friends Hid and seek.

title: Loved it
review: It's simple, thrilling and it's hard work. We loved the place. The caves are natural and the pathway to enter and exit them are adventerous and twisted. It's was so much fun. A must try in Nainital..

title: Great adventure spot!
review: It has five caves, and exploring them is tricky, sometimes scary, and really worth the effort of squeezing through tight spots. Not recommended for claustrophobics.

title: Nainital visit
review: not much to explore in Nainital city. For boating and other things other lakes are much better. Mall Road is good for shopping and hotels

title: Bad
review: Very bad place. Just u will be tired there nothing else. Very dirty caves are there in the park. No maintenance.

title: Caves
review: Caves are thrilling and cold , good for people who likes adventure. All caves looked like same for me. Not good for old or heart patient.

title: wesome experience
review: A must do in naintal.

title: A bit unclean and a no for claustrophobics
review: Certain parts are with odd dark corners. A weird stench was there as we reached there. Not all problems are due to the cave authorities. The visitors and tourists are much to be blamed for the litter and stench around

title: Just another cave
review: Nothing interesting. It is just usual cave but interesting for kids. View from top is very beautiful though. Take some photos and enjoy.

title: Good Adventure
review: Visited this first time with Family . Liked it very much .

title: Fun time to explore the depths of the earth! Ancient Caves untouched...
review: Just a lovely feeling of going back to stoneage and experienceing that Cave Lifestyle... cold and thrilling.... really awesome experience.

title: Fun filled experience
review: Gives you a real feel of cave. There are 5 caves here. It is like a multi level game. It gets tougher(slightly).Kids totally enjoy this place

title: Nice old connected caves turned into a garden
review: Four or five caves which are open from two sides. one side to enter and other to exit. They have also placed some other exiting stuff like lake view point, bull ride and flying fox at the garden. Donot miss it if you travel to nainital

title: nice place.
review: well maintained ,  great idea  and unique concept of garden. for children its quite interesting to see how animal stays in caves. so they will enjoy a lot this adventures cave garden.

title: Boring place
review: Not Worth.. Kids might find it attractive... but its a pretty boring place.. Nothing much to do.. the caves look staged and fails to thrill.

title: eco cave garden
review: basical in this garden there are o many cave of different animals .thrilling place for youngester not good for small kids

title: NOT AT ALL GOOD
review: NOT AT ALL Interesting wastage of money 40/- they charge person  not worth it not a good place to visit rather than we prefer to see Himalaya darshan with awesome tea and maggi

title: Eco Cave Gardens
review: nice small caves park, we reach there when We took the tour of the points around Nainital, small attraction but still nice and well made.

title: Very exiting
review: We 14 friends visited cave garden on 19/2/2016

title: A good place to test your fitness & flexibilit
review: Picture added to the place is not actual. Overall it is a nice place to test your fitness & flexibility by going through various caves in the garden. Even in some of the caves you need to even crawling down on the ground which makes you please alive and joyful.

title: Awesome!
review: Must visit! Kids will enjoy! Senior citizens should avoid it! Do click photos in the daku and other get ups!

title: Garden of caves.
review: Cool and nice photos you can click here. It is garden of caves with name Tiger, Panther. You will enter from one way and you will exit from another cave. It is really a good place.

title: If you are with Kids.. Do Visit Eco Cave Gardens
review: A Good Place for Kids.. They would enjoy.. Man Made Caves... Eco Caves tickets has to be purchased...

title: Nice Experiance
review: Kids enjoy here most!! we found some adventure activities like Zip line, bull ride etc. inside the gardens. good place to visit.

title: Cave.... Cave...Cave....
review: If you are really interested to see How Animals live.... Go and visit Cave Garden.... Nice Caves.... Enjoy to Pass through it like Animal......

title: Good place to chill out for short duration
review: Good place to visit for an hour or two of various activities.  Lot of activities for kids.  Vehicle parking could be a problem.

title: Just natural habitat ....CAVES !!
review: Not much to see der .....just natural habitat feeling ... caves all around !!

title: Great place to view the caves
review: It's a beautiful collection of caves with some bit of adventure attached to it. Young people with kids are certainly going to enjoy this, but considering the place a no go for elders.

title: Good activity
review: There are six to seven caves. Exploring every cave gives the ultimate feeling.Go and explore the most adventurous of the caves. Its awesome.

title: Scary but adventurous
review: The chain of five caves are not for infants, senior citizens and people with heart problem. Most adventurous is porcupine cave. Sometimes you have to crawl to pass the caves. Very well maintained park for children. Rs.40/- ticket is value for money. A must see place.

title: Excellent- Well maintained and scary
review: Just think of earthquacke can happen any time and then entre inside... oops it was scary.

title: Wonderful architenture!
review: The caves are beautiful and the good thing is that unlike most of the small indian attractions this place was really clean. Just go there and sit watching some birds nearby. I went with my friends and really liked the calmness of the place.

title: must view this place
review: very deep & beautiful caves. You have to visit this place once when u visit Nanital.one of good attraction in local points

title: Eco cave garden
review: Nice place for children to visit to see true flora in its original form and place. Greenery that I liked most. If you are nainital u should see

title: Good for children...
review: Quite entertaining if you have children with you. For couples, its a good option to pass some time. The caves are quite deep and gives  a scary look.

title: Good workout ...
review: Explore natural caves.  Hard for those who have problem with climbing, as well as for those who are afraid of closed spaces ..

title: natural cave must visit with children s
review: this one of unique experience at this hill station.. natural caves ...fox , tiger caves ...bulky healthy people and people with high blood pressure should avoid this place...children below 3 years should avoid this place ...but fun to visit caves its modified with steps for tourist.

title: Eco Cave Gardens
review: The Eco cave gardens are not that satisfactory. But the view from the top is good. The cave has some stairs which are really tough to climb.

title: Natural place
review: yes it is natural place ,at out side the garaden you do not relize is there any foresty type place but they have

title: Natural caves
review: tiger caves and panther caves are beautiful natural caves. Not very well maintained. Entrance fees 40 per head.

title: Good experience
review: This was a good experience to go though very narrow caves. I took this in the late evening where I could not complete go though all the caves due to light. I suggest this to be done in the mornings to get good enjoyment.

title: Great Concept
review: The eco caves is a great concept & a must visit tourist spot in Nianatal.Only ones with supple body are advisable to go as the caves have narrow spaces & lots of crawling & descending to do.

title: Had loads of fun crawling through the caves
review: It was really fun passing through those caves. Though most of the caves are modified for easy accessibility, it was overall fun there.

title: cave garden
review: visit it for sheer adventure and hrill to go inside natural cave and come out surprisingly...it is 3 km from naini lake and easily located..must visit...

title: An experience
review: Caves are really as per their names. Scary, thrilling and temperature inside was like an AC fit within. You experience a drastic deep in temperature as you enter the caves. I went inside 4 out of six. However some are really scary with tiny passages to squeeze you. Be careful with kids and aged people with problems in legs must avoid.

title: Average
review: If you have extra time then go dhr as there is nothing great to watch there.....only one cave and a view point....

title: EXCITING!!
review: We had fun walking inside the cave a sort of little adventure.

title: Quick thrills
review: This place is a quick fix if you are seeking a pseudo adventure kick. There are five caves of which 3 have narrow passage which requires one to be flexible. It takes not more than 20 minutes to walk through all of them as you bend your body to move through the passages.
