It is humorous to watch people pose in these caves for pictures and one can't help but photobomb. Otherwise it is a long wait for them to finish. On a serious note, I'll recommend a quick visit.

title: Eco gardens visit
review: I hiked from Nainital lake to the eco gardens. U can take a rikshaw to mallital n from the masjid walk to ur right till eco cave garden. It was like a botanical garden. The caves are actually fissures or gaps between huge rocks. Its a one time visit spot. Families can have a nice time there

title: Quick Adventure
review: Nicely built place which gives you a but of idea how animals habitats are. Tiger Cave, Panther cave, bat cave, Porcupine cave and finally the Ape cave. Involves a lot of physical activity.

title: eco cave garden
review: eco cave garden is a unique kind of thing .here we can see cave of tiger ,wool and many other animals .no need to higher a taxi if you are having a car .they will foll you that you wont we able to go yourself

title: The fittest will enjoy
review: This actually gives an experience of getting in and out of caves. Only difference is that you have light bulbs in the cave and can be assured that no animals are there. The Panther and tiger caves were cake walk. But you enter inside the bat cave only iff you are fit. DO NOT ENTER THE BAT CAVE IF YOU HAVE ANY KIND OF PAIN OR IF YOU ARE MORE THAN 2XL SIZE. Thats because you need to crawl, bend,  jump, squeeze yourself to go through the caves. The only way to come out of bat cave is through Apes cave. And there you need to lift you body weight with your hand over a rock two times. The first time I got stuck, Thank God , I some how released myself. (hehehe) Next time I learnt the technique. YOU NEED GOOD GRIPPING SHOES. I suffered without them. Some rocks are slippery. But of course when you come out, you know you had funnnnnn!!!! What an adventure! If you are sick, aged and/or more than 2-3XL size (I am very close :D  ), avoid bat cave entry.

title: Enjoyable Experience
review: Visited Tiger and Panther Caves. Enjoyed the experience of moving inside the caves without banging our heads. Had a great time with family.

title: Wonderful experience at Cave garden
review: My experience at Cave garden was wonderful.this is artificial garden having many caves like tiger,bat etc.few caves are very narrow so would be difficult for overweight people.As u need to crawl in few caves,so ur clothes may get dirty.Not recommended for obesed people.

title: leopard cave so narrow..
review: i have visited cave garden and this cave garden is partially natural and artificially done up. there are vrious kind of caves named upon the animals. one must  give a try to go through all ,,you will have fun...

title: Amazing Adventurous Caves
review: Lifetime experience the natural habitats of bats, fox, panthers and many more with fun and adventurous. Need to be careful entering these caves, as many have water flowing thru it, stones r slippery. You can also enjoy flying fox there too.

title: Amazing experience of caves
review: really a amazing experience. a must visit place for enjoyment amongst the feel of nature. natural looking caves. slightly tricky to move in between. mind your head

title: Time waste!
review: Too much hyped...ticket price is costly...You'll see nothing but a few artificial caves...Not recommended

title: So good
review: I have been to Nainital several times but never visited these. First time, on the way, I landed there. It was a unique experience- though we did not venture going deep in caves as it required us to go thru very narrow passage. One should have proper footwear to enter the caves to avoid getting slipped.

title: Natural beauty
review: The cave garden is a nice place with natural caves of animals in which u experience. Deep and dark inside. Really cold in winter

title: Amazing Place
review: at North side of lake , its the place with natural caves, very cold during winters and must visit place for all

title: it is just like adventure.
review: passing from the cave!! well that is not usual we does in our life..it may seems once..what is the adventure when passing inside the rocks. but it was awesome. must try once. not recommened for old age or very healthy person..as they have to climb/down the rocks..evrything else is good, kids above 5 will love it

title: Get a health before visiting these caves
review: Dear Visitors

title: Must Visit if you are travelling to Nainital
review: It is not near to the Mall road but you will find cabs which will give you a tour in a reasonable rate.

title: Do Not Go Out of Your Way to Visit.
review: Only if you are passing & do not have any plans for anything else would I recommend visiting here.

title: not so great
review: Not so great...good caves but not much to see..need to be careful while passing thru but not much to see around.

title: nice adventurous
review: nice interesting  and surprising  to this kinda place in a city...good concept...must visit ...in cave experience

title: A totally different experience
review: There are many caves in the cave garden. Bat cave is the cave you should keep in your list.  But make sure you visit this place only in summer because its a cave you will find many water flows if you visit during wrong time .

title: Amazing place for fun
review: A great place for a change in hill station. There are caves and you have to cross them with tactics. Had a great time there with my wife and kids.

title: surprisingly tiring
review: beautifully moderated the natural caves. but it is not advisable for people aged above 50 years or people with asthma or related problem due to the frequent ups and downs in the caves

title: Eco caves at nainital
review: A nice concept. The caves are difficult to roam and it is not advisable to plan it with infants. it would take you couple of hours to see it thoroughly.

title: Must Go
review: Caves are very good and you have to put some effort to pass through these caves. You should not take child with you as it can be suffocating for children below 3-4 years.

title: "Adventurous"
review: It is Located in Sukhtal or Mallital as it is commonly known, on the Kaladungi road, it is a natural park maintained by the local administration. It is approx 1 km from the Mail Road. It is comprises of SIX small caves with the forms of tiger, panther, porcupine and so on.

title: Awesome natural caves
review: Total caves r 6 and very natural. Fat people may face difficulty in passing through caves. This is a perfect place to experience the natural deep caves. Be carefull caves stones r slippery so go slow inside and its good if go in group.

title: Exciting for adventurous person
review: It has got 4 caves; Tiger cave, Panther cave, Bat Cave and Porcupine cave. I went in the first two but left out the last two as I was in no mood to enter into those creepy man made caves.. May be adventurous people would like it. It has got a canteen on top which we gave a miss as our tummies were pretty full that time.

title: Brilliant  Caves
review: There are various type of Caves inside Eco Cave Gardens. We enjoyed there. Never miss to visit this Cave.

title: Nothing special
review: This place has some caves where the people are led through some stairs and they come out from other side... Nothing else. Nothing special to even visit this place.

title: Must do thing
review: I liked the caves its worth trying specilly cave walk its a new experience first of a kind.

title: Amazing & Natural place
review: Amazing place to hangout with your friends & Family.But You are Asthma or heart patient then you can't go inside the cave bcz there is Clearly mention before when you enter in cave 'Asthma or heart patients go on your risk'. Best place to photosession. when you will travel in the cave n garden it will be look like that it is natural.

title: Nainital - Jun 2015
review: The cave garden is close to Sukhatal. There are 5 different caves created here (e.g. tiger etc.). Not sure whether these are natural or man-made. It is quite an adventure to visit all these. Not recommended with small children and elderly people. Inside the park, otherwise it is just ok; nothing much to talk about.

title: Mar 2014
review: Nice and adventurous some caves not for chubby people. Though you have to be cautious as the rocks are slippery. Different levels of difficulty too

title: Bhulbhulaiya
review: A very good place for kids and adults to enjoy the fun of caves and pass through the small and narrow openings.  You can enjoy these caves and spend almost 4-5 hours and enjoy them

title: A Romantic Place for couples
review: An excellent place to go...beautifully maintained gardens and caves... landscaping is very good.  Peaceful Quiet and Romantic

title: Adventurous Eco Caves
review: Very good experience of caves of wild animals. Kids will enjoy this like anything. Worth visiting this place.

title: A must try with friends and family
review: Just am amazing experience. The caves are well nurtured and convoluted enough to give you a good time.

title: Adventure !
review: Wasn't aware that such a place exist, its full of natural caves with different height and topography and a good fun place for adults/gents and kids.

title: Amazing Experience
review: Very Amazing Experience in caves. My 4 years old kid also enjoyed lot in these caves. Little risky in rainy session.

title: Kids loved it
review: Nice natural caves , a must visit place in nanital ,  not suitable for asthma or heart patient and heavy travellers as some part of caves are very narrow and oxygen level also dips in between.

title: Good place to explore one's adventurous side
review: As the caretakers of the place told us, the eco cave gardens were actually used by different fauna (tiger, flying fox, bats, leopard, monkeys, etc) although realistically they are too close together to house such a variety. They are definitely damp and colder but test the adventurous streak of city-dwellers.

title: One of a kind!
review: This is a one of a kind place. You can go through the maze of these naturally formed caves, some of which are connected with one another. It is thrilling experience for the kids to enter these narrow caves filled with darkness and come out from the other end. Simply amazing!

title: must visit
review: a marvelous man made caves, a top the hill have a look at the valley with the help of a telescope Rs/10/- for 5 minutes.

title: Small Caves but thrilling
review: There are small 5-6 caves but they are thrilling, one must go thru them if one is visting Nainital, in case you are with kids, you need to be a little careful and in case you are with infants, please don't take them inside.

title: "Small adventurous place, must visit"
review: This is a must visit place in nainital. There are at least 6-7 different caves, where you go from one side, and come out from another side. The Caves are well lit, but there is no proper way, so it is very adventurous to go through the rocky paths. Be careful of your head, at some places you really have to walk on your knees. Most people visit only the first cave, and thinks all are same, but my advice is to visit all the caves. Be in the cave when nobody is there, and you can feel the thrill of being inside a cave. The place is very well maintained, but still i felt bad seeing empty water bottles and plastics inside cave.

title: Excellent art work.
review: Worth a visit and spending some time to meandare across the built in caves. Helps gain knowledge about the animals using those caves.Such a great feeling for some time.

title: Eco Cave Gardens
review: The Eco Cave Garden is fast becoming a popular destination. Located in Sukhtal or Mallital as it is commonly known, on the Kaladungi road, it is a natural park

title: Thrilling Cave.. must go !
review: There are only 5-6 caves but were very thrilling, must go if visting Nainital, surely worth a visit and you will ask for more.

title: A little adventure
review: I visited the eco caves in June 2015 and had a fulfilling experience. The gardens consist of 7 interconnected caves. Two or three of these are extremely narrow and you have to crawl through; these are also the most thrilling. After each cave you have the option to either exit or continue into the next one. Although not advisable for the aged, and very young children, everyone else should definitely experience the caves.

title: Nice place to experience a small level adventure
review: The Eco Cave Gardens may appear anything from a run-down random stony place to a place catering to the adventurous trait of people who are not into much physical exercise. According to the caretaker, the caves were naturally inhabited by the likes of foxes, leopard, tiger, bats, etc. and have now been turned into an attraction. The caves are quite damp and cold - the level of difficulty is medium. Avoid going alone unless you have help at the cave openings as not many people prefer to explore the cave routes, particularly the smaller and narrower ones.

title: Thrilling experience
review: It is a must go place if you visit nainital. Full of adventure and fun. It has simple to complex caves. Very naturally build and beautifully maintained.

title: dnt go
review: as the place is highly crowded ppl r literally pushing each other a major prob of space and vehical parking and da place is kinda dirty

title: A new experience
review: Till now we had seen the animal Hills on the tv only...but seeing them so closey and entering them was once in a. Lifetime experience...though a bit hesitant initially as how the entry and exit in the caves would be like and how much dark would they be...but enjoyed a lot

title: Great
review: Going inside the cave was a greta experience especially with my 4 year old daughter, it was not very tough and not too easy.

title: MUST Visit
review: An absolutely must visit place in Nainital. I was not expecting much when I went there and after reaching, I love the whole idea of going through the little caves. I absolutely enjoyed it. If you are worried about your clothes and that you might spoil them and such, then i would suggest not to go, as there might be places where you will have to get both you hands and clothes dirty.

title: Nice place but....
review: Fun place. In Nature.

title: Nice place..
review: Nice to visit here..cave is dark and creepy inside..watch your steps..slippery..and take pics and enjoy..

title: Must Visit Place
review: Natural habitats of tiger, panther, fox, apes, bats turned into park for tourist. Some of the caves are very difficult to cross, but a good thrill and completely safe to cross. Must visit during your nainital visit

title: Adventure that comes in a very small package..
review: You think it'd be a great adventurous place, but its only 3/5. They have some caves you can explore, as a small way through the stones, slippery sometimes, very narrow at some places and hard to climb for a few. So make sure that you really want to enter in. Also they have weird names for those caves.. At some places it provides great background for the pics.

title: Must Go in Nainital
review: the Eco cave gardens are located in Sukhatal, infact they were walking distance from our KMVN hotel in Sukhtal ... its quite a unique experience, they are actual caves in which one can enter and .... there are 6 caves in all incl Porqupine cave, bats cave, tiger cave, panther cave n 2 more, there are no actual animals there ... but I had a word with one of the attendants and he informed that sometimes in winters animals do come in as the place is connected to Corbett reserve.

title: Uncommon n beautiful attraction as compared to many hill stations
review: The sight is a natural park maintained by district Tourism and is easily accessible by road and of course the drive is scenic. BTW it is not far at all but one needs to climb a few steps. Tickets cost 20, 10 and 25 for ADT, CHD and camera respectively. For both adults & kids, the inter-connected caves instill a feeling of mystery, fun and adventure. Tiger cave is easier as compared to Panther cave.

title: Only for Children.
review: The place is only for kids. Artificial Caves are built. Maximum 30 mins can be spend here. Enjoy tea at KMVN located in front of garden

title: cool caves
review: the cooling caves are unique, the summer outside is just not noticeable inside, it was cool and tranquil....  take care overhead....

title: be a child to enjoy the place
review: Never experienced such a place earlier. made all of us become child again passing thru narrow passages

title: Injoy nature
review: Very natural cave but its man maded garden

title: Adventurous
review: Eco cave gardens gave us a bit of adventure amidst the sight seeing trip of nainital. There are around 6-7 different natural caves which at some points get a bit scary as you really have to crawl to pass through these caves.

title: Loved them
review: It was so much fun exploring the caves. Been to Nainital earlier too but this is the first visit to the caves and I recommend whoever wants some adventure, specially a must visit for kids

title: ADVENTURE IN GARDEN !!!
review: Caves are really nice and adventurous. Easy for kids and grown ups to pass through.

title: A small cave split in two parts offering  hill view at the finish.
review: nominal entry fee and its worth one visit.We went along with two families and enjoyed the view.It hardly takes  minimum 15 minutes  and maximum half an hour for a complete cave journey.

title: Very Good caves
review: Very nice caves. Just do not miss visiting it. All caves beautifuly crafted from rocks. Worth visiting. No doubt.

title: Great experience;  go for it !!
review: A must visit place.  The eco cave is a series of 6 caves with animal names.  Tiger cave, Panther cave, bat cave, squirrel cave, flying fox cave and ape cave.

title: Go for Adventure in Caves
review: Its a mix of Natural and artificial caves which has Tiger cave, Panther Cave, Flying Fox, Ape cave and porcupine cave etc. Its real fun been here and most adventurous activity You can have near Nainital, within 5 kms of Premises. Easy to reach and good fun to go with Family. Like all tourist places it has food outlet and chargea are INR 40 only. Go and Enjoyyy:)

title: A unique experience
review: We liked this different type of gardens. It was full of different caves. Some were at various levels and we could climb up and down seeing them. Its an interesting landscaping and use of the natural levels in this hill.

title: Sweet experience.
review: I was there with family. We went inside the cave. It is not very easy to be inside. It was dark and cool.Have to move like a child. But very romantic and interesting. I would like to go again.

title: Good Adventure passing through Caves
review: Good adventure passing through narrow caves.Some of them are so narrow u can not sit and you have to literraly scroll to pass through.

title: Enjoyment for Kids and fun for Oldies
review: These caves are situated within city limits, it takes 10-15 minutes ride from mall road to this place, these eco caves are named behind animals, it is not advisable for ppl with heavy body as you might get stuck or feel uneasy or suffocated but worth a visit.

title: DO NOT MISS
review: My four year girl insisted on three inside visits and ready for more trips, Cooler than Hill station Nainital when inside, Entry steep steps to be avoided by elderly & asthama patients

title: must see spot
review: We can enjoy different caves there. even though difficult to enter but its a great experience which we can't see other places

title: Very Good place
review: This is a different experience, Entering in Lion and Panthor caves is just a great experience. Location is not far from mall road.

title: excellent experience
review: a very good place to visit, specially caves there are awesome, not for old people kids above 5 are good to enjoy, I like tiger cave and panther one.

title: A change from the usual hill station stuff
review: Something different and worth visiting if you are bored of all the temples,lakes,food n even the noise.

title: Interesting park which exhibits various kinds of caves
review: it's avery good experience to look at and get into various caves for animals, birds and apes.  However, woudl suggest thatappropriate sign boards for getting into and getting out of caves be placed for better experience

title: strange but good different place
review: Eco Cave Gardens is a place to visit compulsorily. Although it is not suitable for old persons, heart patients, pregnant women and physically weak people to enter into caves. You need to be fit if you want to enjoy fully. We enjoyed a lot and really caves are so horrible place I could feel that. :)

title: Thrilling destination,must see once
review: Cave garden with rocks.Have a feel inside and you will rock yourself.It was full of natural beauty and in the end,have a town view from top of hill.Click some pics and take away memories with you.

title: Nice place
review: Caves are very cool, but annoying thing is that people will stop in between and start clicking pics so it takes a lot of time to cross a cave.

title: Must visit, get into the caves, don't get scared!!
review: Nice place, garden with 4-5 caves, you must get into the caves. Cheetah caves and one nearby is easy. You'll feel very cold inside the caves. Bat caves and porcupine caves are bit difficult so take care.

title: must visit site for young and children
review: Very nice activity filled fun park for children and young...better to be avoided by elderly....good adventure activity while going through the different caves...kids just love it

title: Flexibility test
review: Nice place to go with kids for a bit of adventure and test your flexibility to pass through all different types of caves. Tip go early in morning to avoid rush

title: Some Adventure you will love!!!
review: Add  some excitement & adventure in your trip to nainital.

title: Just caves
review: there are 2 caves.  You will have to take around 50 steep steps to reach this place. Cost around 40 Rs per head for Indians. Its a different experience of walking inside the caves. Advice: don’t ware sari and go there. For ladies-ware shoes not the chappals

title: A Time Pass
review: if you have time and you have noting to do, visit this place, going in a cave and coming out that's it,

title: Must Visit
review: Amazing place, they got really well maintained place with 2-3 deep caves which are so freaking cold. There is also a small adventure of rope slope done by Flying Fox guys over there which does give a adrenalin rush, a small one though.

title: Experience of Caves
review: This gives you an experience of going inside a Cave. The caves is of different sizes in which you have to crawl inside the cave and in some you have to climb. It was slippery during rainy time.

title: Can be called as Not bad..
review: Just a viewing point.. there are many caves.. each having different names.. n there is carving of that animal inside the cave.. If u have ample time, go there.. otherwise don't invest ur time here..

title: superb experience in caves
review: it is exceptional to experience the caves.... my family thoroughly enjoyed the caves... My daughter was thrilled to move thru the caves.. one should mine his/her head while passing thru the cave. it is well lit & safe to move thru

title: Adventure
review: It is brilliant. made my trip. The path was very narrow. We have to go through natural caves. the place is well maintained.

title: Do not miss this!
review: We were not knowing about this. We were just asking our driver for places to see and he took us to this place. It's an amazing place. It has naturally formed caves and if one has to see those, need to pass through those caves. Gives an amazing experience to find a path through rocks and thin spaces in between. We went through tiger, leopard, porcupine and fox caves. Could not go through the bat cave as we would have required to literally lie down and pass through it.

title: Caves... a tingling experience
review: Entry fee -Rs 40 for adults and Rs 20 for kids... worth every buck you spend...

title: Nice, that all you can say !
review: There are caves ( Slippery caves and you have to be very careful )

title: Adding Major value to Nainital, a must visit place.
review: First of all it’s a very well maintained place by the Nainital Authorities, Well done...!!!

title: No words to describe
review: This is a fabulous place to visit. You can sense the wilderness as soon as you step in to the garden and follow the first guided steps to the Tiger cave. These are natural caves and the govt. has tried to maintain the originality. The light bulbs inside the caves are just sufficient to find your way. You can feel the chill in your spine from the thought that a tiger lived once here-and it did. Similarly, there are caves of Porcupine, Hyena, bats and many more and getting out of each cave becomes difficult. Yet, the garden is very safe for children and also brings them close to nature, which is a unique feature.

title: Big disappointment
review: Nothing is there just caves underneath. Yes they allow you to walk through them, but make sure its not raining as it becomes very slippery. Claustrophobic should avoid. No toilets in the cave garden (in case of emergency) but a paid one near the entry gate.

title: Adventure
review: Although there is only one attraction at this place, which is obviously the caves, it still leaves you with a bit of adventure as some of the caves have very narrow passages and many people generally find it difficult to traverse. Another point is the coolness in the caves inspite of the heat outside.

title: Caves are not Natural and not Well Lit
review: We went there in January as it was part of the 7 points tour we took in Nainital. The caves are not fully natural and are man made. They are not easy to access and are also not well lit. There are no guides no give details of cave formations and there is not much to do.

title: Adventurous place
review: The name itself describes this place. You will find variety of caves here. It was fun exploring these caves. The narrow and slippery passages were a challenge for us. The caves were properly lit with halogen lights. There is rappelling too which one can enjoy.

title: Nothing great
review: Stopped at the eco caves on our way to the touristy horse ride (Dorothy's seat) , eco caves and some hill view point.. The eco caves are pretty average but can be visited once given lack of other activities/options in the city..

title: Explore the rocky caves
review: The Eco Cave Garden is a network of interconnected rocky caves both natural and man made and gardens around.This was an exciting, fun filled and informative experience for us.

title: Unbeatable - Go if you are under 80kgs with a waist line of 32-34inches !!!!
review: Wow !! Are you flexible enough to challenge the BATS, FLYING FOX, TIGERS, MONKEYS and APE's !!! Feels like you enter a refrigerator when you go in these small caves...An expedition i should say..Super fun...The outside weather was around 20 degrees and the caves go down straight to 0-2 degrees...With dim lights kept by the cave guys, a really photogenic place and capture memories....Entrance is INR 50 per person...An hour can pass by easily..A must go !!!

title: not for fat people
review: It is a small place and a new attraction. As you have  enter narrow caves so all the adults of a family need not buy ticket. After a steep climb you have fun in entering 4 caves , with kids it is a fun but we may need to be careful that on the slippery rocks and not get hurt. Have a good pair of shoes before venturing. You do also have a mini  fox flying for kids. Overall it is fun if you like to stretch , bend crawl in the caves.

title: SMALL BUT ENJOYABLE
review: Here are the caves to see - like a Disney attraction just on the Northern side of Nainital on the way to highcourt.

title: Fun trip
review: Away from city noise, calm, quite and interesting place. Situated at walking distance from high court. There are 3-4 man made caves. The best one was tiger and panther caves. Its a short adventure trip worth visiting for young people. Entry ticket 40. The view above is also good.

title: A little adventure
review: Ticket- Yes ( ₹40 in 2014)  Parking- Available

title: Nice park
review: It is a medium size park that can be best enjoyed with friends or young kids. There are artificial caves of different shape and sizes. One would see the lightings inside the cave to make it more attractive. Don't forget to carry your camera as the park gives ample opportunity for photography.

title: It is fun if you want to enjoy it ..
review: A very decent place to be in specially if you want to stay away from hustle of other tourist destinations of nainital. It is not as huge as some of other caves in India but very exciting to traverse through them. Regardless of everything else it is a very good workout and can be a stiff challenge for some of the bulky people around.

title: Adventurous place, especially for kids
review: Great fun exploring the cave, but make sure you are agile and flexible since some parts of the passage are narrow.

title: great experience
review: If you are adventurous , then this place is for you ...climbing the rocks inside the caves ,, little bit of light but its a fun..One thing you really need to be flexible enough to get into the caves as some caves have very narrow openings ,,bit of cold inside the caves ,,Some caves are really dark ,,you need to turn on your mobile's light ..But yes a cool place to enjoy ..There are 6-7 caves..Just make your way into these exciting caves and enjoy your trip..

title: Safe adventure.
review: It was a unique opportunity to get feel of real cave of Tiger , panther and birds.

title: Caves + Rappelling - Fun for kids
review: A network of inter-connected rocky caves and hanging gardens, it leads the visitor into a an ancient dream. There are 6 caves are of our prehistoric ancestors with the forms of tiger, panther, porcupine and so on. One has to bend a lot to pass through the caves. Beware of your backs...

title: Nothing great
review: Just a bunch of really tiny caves that you can enter from one side and exit form other. If you have very few days in Nainital, give this a miss. Not really worth it.

title: A new entrant to Nainital
review: Popular place for all ages, especially little children, Eco Cave garden is a new addition of Nainital. It's worth a visit

title: Good & Adventuring
review: Thrilling caves if you'd like some adventure. They are different caves & the most thrilling is the bat cave. Pls try.

title: Very nice experience
review: Went to these caves on both of my visits to Nainital. Though could not go through all the caves still it was a good experience. The temperature inside the caves gets a little more cooler then it is outside specially in Dec-Jan. Not reccomended for toddlers and people with breathing troubles

title: Nice caves
review: There are a bunch of cave and some of them are pretty small and tight in space to crawl into, must do activity if you have kids they will just love it and also some of the caves are interconnected to do you really go deep.

title: good to see natural cave
review: first time i have seen natural cave of tiger,,,monkey ...nd other animal..good experiance....must see for them who never seen a natural cave,,,nd also some good view from sitting area

title: Must Visit
review: Its a nice place and well maintained. Its certainly an attraction, these natural caves are surely a must visit. You have to climb, go in the dark and some places do not have air as well.

title: different experiences
review: i like the thrilling experience of the caves, difficult at times while need to incorporate more games to enhance the fun.

title: Caves
review: Thre place only have different caves in different shapes and the names are also like that only. Tiger cave is most amazing one. you need to go up and down in the natural caves

title: Eco Caves: Natural caves
review: We visited this place on our college's educational trip. This place is excellent and very adventurous. This place is very beautiful, calm and eco friendly. This place is not for elder people. This place is for young people only.

title: A good place to visit when in Nainital
review: The eco park had various underground caves to explore. The view from the top is also excellent. There are statues of various animals made from eco-friendly material. There is an entrance fee for this attraction.

title: excersice
review: we can have a great time in the cave cos its healthy for those who does not exercise at home. Atop we can view good landscape and relax our muscles......

title: Can be given a miss.
review: It is basically a place with few caves which are named such as "Tiger Cave", "Panther Cave", "Flying Fox Cave" etc. The idea is to give a feeling of what the caves of these animals are like. Many people like this but for me personally it was a total time waste as you just get down the cave and find nothing and then go back up just to enter another cave which becomes tiring and frustrating. The landscaping was nicely done and there is a view point which is okay and a food stall which is great.

title: A perfect match for adventurous people
review: I had underestimated the place before visiting! It has a series of caves (challenging ones) You even need to crawl in a few. All caves were properly named and maintained to my surprise. The temperature in the caves probably goes below zero even during day time as sunlight does not reach them. They are properly lit though.

title: Good adventure
review: Good fun for those who don't hesitate from a little physical exertion and love some adventure.. Enjoy the nature..

title: A fun afternoon activity
review: The caves were very inexpensive, and very enjoyable. The caves probably aren't very safe for very small children, or very elderly people as well. We went with kids around the age 10-13, along with adults and the kids as well as the adults enjoyed it. They also had a zipline for a 50rupee fee that was fun for both adults and kids alike.

title: Back to the childhood...
review: It is worth to experience staying a few minutes in the caves, in which once the tigers, leopards, foxes etc were freely moving and staying... The ups and downs and Hide and seek within the caves is really enjoyable, but take care of your head every time...:) :) :)

title: Eco caves
review: the place is ok as there were lots of tourists...plus we had a very small kid...it was tough to navigate the caves...not recommend to groups with very old/young members......

title: Just a walk ..... or an adventure ? Your choice !!
review: This is a nature trail near Nainital, complete with paths, a few cute little steep staircases and some really adventurous caves !! This is worth a visit if only for the park and the trees, if you are feeling adventurous, you could walk through the caves, which, in places and quite narrow and you will need to mind your head !!

title: Adventurous Trip
review: The Tickets were very cheap.Amazing experience..Not for Senior citizens and Very Small children.An amazing and must visit place in Nainital. Must try this adventurous place.place. There  is even a Restaurant near the view point and even Zip line that charges 50 rupees is is worth Trying.overall Awesome experience.

title: Worth a visit
review: Cave Garden is series of caves which is worth a visit. This not for the Old, Fat and kids as there are steep stairs within the cave park and within the cave there are ups and downs which need more physical energy and power to go thorough. some parts of the caves are too narrow where a person of heavy built can stuck.

title: Be adventurous
review: There are a series of deep and narrow caves here that can be explored. Great fun but you need to be slender and agile to get through some of the spaces. Not far from the town centre but it's probably best to go by car. Quite a longish, uphill walk.

title: Beware claustrophobics..
review: Well there are series of caves to explore named as tiger caves, panther caves, apes caves and bats caves. Bats caves are the narrowest and I had to literally creep through it to get out. Supposedly I had to climb a rock in panther cave to make my way out. Overall it was pretty adventurous experience though not meant for claustrophobics, elderly and small kids.

title: Amazing Experience
review: I had just no idea of what they before I delved into them. They are really very adventurous and at places you have to think how to move forward. However once you complete only thing comes in mind is Hurraaayyy

title: Adventure unplugged!!
review: A cave garden with lot of caves like panther cave, tiger cave etc...an adventurous place to visit, that too in summer. Caves as expected are really cool inside, but entry, exit & paths are a bit dangerous. Be sure to have a good footwear, take extra care of children. Also has a lovely garden and small adv like rope gliding...a good option indeed, mainly not so far from Nainital...

title: Cave gardena at Sukha Tal nr nanital
review: A wonderful experience in visiting this lovely place . It comprises of 6 natural gardens. Starting in chronological order  Panther cave , Tiger cave , Porcupine cave , Bat cave , Flying fox cave and lastly Ape cave. The caves possibly are named as per the features of these animals. With the easiest being Panther and Tiger cave and Ape cave being the most difficult adventure. The difficulty is only to the extent of the Height one has to climb inside the cave. In some caves one has to almost lie down to get through. But the overall experience is really good Kids really enjoy it. To enjoy the nature I would recommend one to walk down from the malital parking via DHANDI Sarak  (cold road) and finally turn left from Manu Maharani hotel and one finds the cave garden on the left side  near the Petrol Pump.

title: An innovative tourist spot
review: It is newly developed tourist spot at Nainital. It gives feeling of natural rock garden.It is very interesting to compare  the shapes and curves according to  nomenclature awarded to different caves .Better to see it in morning time when you feel most energetic.One should not forget to wear shoes during visit.Keep  watch on your kid because it is slippery at some places.You may carry some energy drink for refreshing .

title: Spooky
review: The caves were amazing, though we could muster enough courage to go through only 2 of the 6. The starting two, tiger cave and panther cave are doable, we had small children with us who could manage. The caves are dark, damp and slippery at places, so wearing good grip shoes is advised....but whoa the adrenaline rush you get there is awesome. a must go

title: Not a must visit
review: An above average place. Not a must visit. Probably ppl with kids would like it more. The caves are dark,damp & slippery at some places so wearing good footwear is advised. Also mind your head.

title: A must visit in Nainital
review: This is a place where we have adventured a new thing. We have been able to see the caves which are showing the replica of the caves where the panther, tiger, bats and other creatures live. There are total 7 caves. The best thing is when you have to pass through it, even some time, to go through u have to literally crawl to pass. It was a very different experience.

title: great experience
review: it will give you great experience, if you are really adventure loving.ally feel how tigers,  By passing this caves you can really experience how tiger, lepord or bats lives in these caves

title: Interesting
review: Had great fun with kids on this adventurous outing, it is very different from the regular activities.

title: Feeling junglee
review: Roaming  thru caves like a forest animal . Dark , 20 feet below surface , without natural lights , gives feeling of jungle . Someone shouldn't miss at nainital

title: The twisted eco caves
review: There are around 5 caves in this garden, each gets more difficult than the previous one. These caves have different names like Tiger Cave, panther caves, porcupine cave etc. It was fun.

title: Must Visit in nanitaal
review: its the only place i found worth visiting in nanitaal...well preserved place ..one can easily spend hours at this place..but make sure visit in early hours or else it will get crowded and you wont be able to enjoy the place..

title: Nice Experiance
review: Among few places to be visited in Nainital.

title: A must visit
review: Must visit point in Nanital. Managed by KMVN Ltd and properly maintained. Natual caves will make your body twist from multiple points and times while entering and inside the caves.

title: Good
review: good experience to learn about caves.

title: Most adventurous
review: There are nearly five caves; easier to harder.these are very cool inside. Little scary also.your body has to work really hard to get through of these.not recommending for fat people

title: Rains ruined chances of visiting
review: The place is about 1.5 km walk uphill from the mall road. Sadly, we arrived there in the rainy season and the caves were closed. Only possible to visit them till April not thereafter. But even with the caves closed, the garden surrounding it, located at the top of the mountain was worth it.

title: must Visit Place
review: Awesome, one of the best attractions in Nainital, do not go if you have kids less than 4... and not at all with infants

title: good
review: very nature caves. first two caves are ok for everyone, but other four only for who can effort for entering into the cave, and the last one too interesting. so little. one of the best tourist point in nainital

title: What an experience...!!!
review: Simply brilliant. I loved it. These are natural caves which have been  electrified for our benefit. Once you are inside them , its a different world. Try doing all of them (I stopped after 3/6). Pls dont take toddlers inside as there are tricky places to navigate. I saw kids older than 5-6 years having fun. It is difficult for elders and fat people as well. But if you are in Nainital, you should visit it once.

title: Fantastic
review: We ( Kids and parents) had a blast at this Garden. Everyone should visit the Garden. We completed all the 5 caves and had great fun.

title: good romantic  place
review: one of the good place in nainital .. give u feel of closeness with mother earth.. for kids its an amazing experience..

title: Very nice !
review: This is a very interesting place which people of all age groups will enjoy.. There are 5 caves ; going through them is real fun !

title: Nice caves... gives a good adventure experience
review: I visited these caves during my recent visit to Nainital and was glad on making this choice. The Eco caves is a great place to see some real caves and the feel the real adventure of passing through some really difficult areas of caves and enjoy the nature !

title: Great Experience
review: It's a must visit to your Nainital. The caves definitely satisfies your adventure spirits to the core. The only downside of the caves is that they are not well maintained. There can be more cleanliness at the caves and maintained to International standards.

title: Time to spend with children
review: As locals say this is recently added  as another point for local sightseeing.The garden is well maintained.Though the main attraction is caves but you can spare time there with beautiful flowers and seating arrangements are also there for comfort.If you are not so eagar to see the cave from inside then it is advisable to not enter inside.You have to mind your head, leg, whole body and what not, even at places you have to crawl.So enjoy it from outside.

title: Natural Caves for great adventure
review: The Eco Cave Garden is fast becoming a popular destination. Located in Mallital, 1km from Mall Road on the Kaladungi  road, it is a natural park  having six natural caves with the forms of tiger, panther, porcupine and so on and a musical fountain. Drive straight up to entrance, climb up a short flight of steps cut into the hill-side and the caves. It is great place for children with lots of activities and fun on offer. The Tiger Cave is the easiest to get in and out. Then the Panther Cave where getting in and out gets harder. These were natural caves and some of the then were really to narrow and going down below is really difficult. You can make your visit to Nainital a memorable one with a trip to these gardens wherein you can introduce your child to an eco-friendly life. Children can make this an informative trip learning all about ecosphere and taking a peek into an adventurous life. Sit and enjoy the great views of surrounding hills.Timings 9.30 am to 5.30 pm

title: Not so good
review: They are fine.although the taxi driver will take you there but i found it as a waste of time and money.these are really creepy.

title: difficult to navigate , natural caves..
review: There are six caves in all. All natural underground structures. I liked the formations but came out clueless about what am I seeing, how these caves were formed, why are they called tiger cave, bat cave etc....? the arthritic and asthmatic should give it a miss, so should fat people lest one gets stuck in narrow places.

title: One of the few awesome places to be
review: Now, this place is value for money. the experience is awesome as you have to crawl, sit, stand, jump to navigate through the caves. It is very good if you are willing to challenge your flexibility. Not recommended for heavy builds and asthmatics.

title: Adventurous point to visit
review: I like this place. The caves are really tough at some points. These looks very natural. I along with my 5 year son covered all the caves. He was very happy with his efforts. Not only caves, this place looks like jungle (not deep) and walking too can be enjoyed. There is a small fountain and some statues also. On farthest point, there is a view point and views are superb. Very good attraction of Nainital.

title: Not great
review: Did not like it. People should not waste money in tickets.

title: Interesting gardens
review: There are many natural caves in this garden and it is very interesting to pass through all of them. Some of the cavesare really narrow and one has to cross them on knees. A must visit place in nainital.

title: going close to nature...
review: It comprises of six caves and a beautiful small mountain garden. The tiny bamboo trees looks awesome. But the caves here are a little creepy and must be avoided by old and fat guys. But for adventure seeking people this is a good fun loving experience.

title: Nice
review: To reach cave garden you would need a taxi or cab, depending upon where are you staying. Caves are similar some are steep and  narrow need to be careful while roaming around. you might get the best clicks for you trip there.

title: Good for kids
review: This is 30 mins well spent esp for younger kids. Near sukhtal. Natural caves - cold and in different shapes making you bend in all shapes and odd light to go in and come out. Not outstanding but it's enjoyable. They also have a musical fountain in evenings. En route to Dorothy's peak etc

title: Good
review: Visit only if you have extra time otherwise you can chuck it. Just caves and nothing else, keep walking walking and walking inside caves.

title: Excellent for kids
review: Kids will really love this place where there are a lot of natural caves to crawl through ...it is kinda mini adventure but avoid taking Senior citizens or anyone less fit

title: Sense of Adventure
review: This was third visit to Nainital and my first visit to the caves.

title: Full of Surprises
review: The best part is that the Visitor actually goes through all the caves which is really fun. It is not a place where you only visit and take pictures but you yourself (if you wish to) go through all the six caves and actively/physically participate while visiting.

title: Kids and young love to go thro..
review: Cave garden has 6-7 caves thro which young and kids can go. Nice experience for city kids to get a feel of the wild .

title: Nothing worth seeing
review: Our Guide took us to visit Eco Cave Gardens. This place has nothing worth seeing. It has 5 caves named Tiger Cave, Bat Cave, etc. It is claimed that Tigers/ Bats/ Leopard used to dwell there. But all 5 caves look the same and all you have to do is enter the cave from one end and come out from other end. There is no one to explain anything there. The fees is merely Rs.30 per person but its a waste of time. Also, its not recommended for Claustrophobic people!!

title: Caves....... wow
review: These caves in here is another experience....... Few were good enough you can walk through. Some you might have to bend, there are few you would really have to crawl on your knees and there is one you would have to walk on your chest lying down flat on the ground. Its an awesome experience if you are going in winter as this exercise will really warm you up.

title: Adventure point
review: Eco Cave Gardens is a natural garden which is situated just next to Kumaon University Campus. It is just 1 km away from Sukhatal and 2 km from Mallital. It has six caves along with a musical fountain

title: Great for a quick trek
review: The caves were really interesting! Some of the caves are not very easy to pass and require you to show some agility. Overall, a good place to have some fun and build a quick sweat!

title: Good exercise and adventurous point only for physically fit people
review: Nice place to visit with 5-6 natural caves (not man-made), ladies and kids can pass through Tiger and Leopard caves but Ape and Bat caves are very narrow and demands decent fitness level to cross them. Our guide told us that few sequences of Hritik Roshan's "Koi Mil Gayaa" was shot in this Eco Cave Garden.

title: must watch !!!
review: Nanitaal visit is incomplete without cave garden. Amazing & Wild  experience .... So beautiful and adventures...

title: Nice experiance
review: The Eco Caves are just amazing. Its a fun to get inside these caves and come out with your knees and arms folded.It is only for physically fit people. A must visit if you thing that you are fit

title: Fantastic Fun!
review: The caves are situated maybe a 10 min drive from Ranikhet. There are a sequence of about 6 caves which get progressively harder. The last few caves require you to get on all fours, so i suggest that you don't wear your best clothes, also although they don;t specify, open toed shoes are a must. Not for the light hearted

title: One of its kind
review: There are many caves to choose from named after animals. Since i suffer from mild asthma,i faced breathing problems after two caves.Not recommended for the old and people suffering from respiratory diseases.

title: Do Not Miss this !!!
review: This place has 5/6 natural caves preserved n modified minimally for viewing.but mind the word minimally.it gives u a totally natural feel of caves,very difficult to negotiate for fat people.many were coming back out of fear midway of the caves,all these caves are interconnected,u enter through one n come out of the last one.its real fun n a bit scary.its very cold inside.asthmatics n heart patients are adviced not to take this adventure as the oxygen conc is a bit low inside the caves; per the instructions written outside the caves. otherwise fit people must visit this !!!

title: Different Place to Visit
review: You will nowhere find place like this. So dense, misty, deep and yet so natural. Must place to visit if you like to see slightly different places.

title: Terrible.
review: A waste of time, I didnt like this place. nothing special just few cave and the ticket is too expensive rs 40 for single person which is not worth paying for it.

title: Claustrophobic!!
review: beware, if you are claustrophobic, think twice before you go..otherwise quite adventurous, little bit dark in the caves.

title: good experience
review: good experience. nice place to visit.

title: Worth a Visit
review: The Eco Caves are towards bazpur road ahead of High Court in Nainital.

title: A wonderfull day out!
review: Had a wonderful time in Eco Cave Garden.. Liked it for Caves (indeed), View from the top, and Costume Photgrapher...

title: Not for the physically unfit
review: It is extremely adventurous but you would need hell of a lot of physical fitness to go through. It is no doubt FUN

title: A Good Physical exercise
review: Liked it very much and my kids loved it. There are 6-7 caves and it will require physical energy to check all the caves. We were sweating in the month of november after visiting all the caves.Some of the caves were so dark that we have to move with mobile phone lights. Not for unfit or older persons. But kids will certainly love it. Ticket is 40 rs per person but it is worth it. You have a small shop in front of it for snacks and tea and you will need it after all the climbing and jumping in caves.

title: Caves with fun
review: Eco Cave Gardens at Nainital is worth place to visit, if you r travelling with family and children. There r different types of caves which provide good enjoyment to children. However it is some what difficult for old age people. But Must visit it.

title: Go with care.
review: These six caves are dead caves. All of them are named after six dangerous animals. People may warn you to be aware of bats but don't worry you won't even see a single ant in these caves.

title: Not soo good
review: Nothing really special about the caves. A person will get bored within few mins. Though there are different names given to the caves but at the end all looks same.

title: A good one
review: Well made and well maintained . A nice walk through and good place to see around . Narrow caves.  beware of those back -aches and cameras .

title: ancient caves
review: superb natural treasure. it is thrilling to go underground and feel that you are really in the lap of nature. the passage to the caves looks scary but it is worth the trouble. panther and tiger caves are sensational.

title: Well preserved attaraction
review: It was quite a surprise to be at this place and walk inside some natural caves said to be earlier inhabited by the wild animals. The amazingly cool climate inside some of the caves revealed that nature beats us hands down on this aspect - it is a marvel to experience and think how we can adopt much more nature friendly climate control measures in our buildings, homes. For those with muscle spasms or joint pains or weak back, knees, I would not recommend the visit inside the caves.

title: nice maintained cave
review: Caves made good & well maintained by the way of cleaning & other things. A nice walk through out the journey in caves. Heavy Person avoid to visit . Who is having a problem of back Pain , Astama , Heart Problem, knee problem  also avoid to go inside the caves. Kids enjoy. worth to visit caves.

title: Extreme fun
review: Lovely place to visit. Awesome fun. Mind you not good for old people. Wear sports shoes while you go to cave garden because some caves r very narrow and rock climbing is also required.

title: Adventurous
review: It  was an adventurous experience as well as great fun to be there,not advisable for heavy & old people as one requires to be extreme flexible so as to cross the caves.Neat and clean with proper lighting and space to sit.

title: Mysterious & Pristine
review: You can make your visit unforgettable with these caves & gardens, introducing your childrens to an eco-friendly life in here. Beautiful & mysterious at the same time.

title: Kids will love it!
review: This is a short walking trail in which you will pass thru several rocky caves. In some places, you will need to crawl. My kids loved it!

title: Do not waste your money
review: It should be free entry. Went there expecting  natural caves but was utterly disappointed. Wastage of time and money.

title: Nicely Made ...Mini Adventure
review: Nice place , i will caution people to watch their heads while passing through caves.

title: Very adventurous
review: I liked the caves very much..they are a bit adventurous too. I didnot no that they will involve a lot of hard work for for me. We had to climb, kneel, lie to cross the caves. We had a very good time.

title: Good for whiling time
review: Okay place. Good for exercising the body. Not for elderly or those travelling with small kids or those who are claustrophobic.

title: Must visit in Nainital
review: Eco Cave gardens is a must visit for the young and adventurous at heart in the Nainital visit. This is a set of 6 mostly natural caves of different complexity and fitness levels (Tiger, Panther, Porcupine, Flying fox, Bats and Apes cave). Each cave has its own entry and exit points and interim exits are well marked. You can leave the trail after finishing a cave and head back to the exit.

title: A must visit place in Nainital - although goverment should focus more on such tourist destination
review: You won't find many good caves in India, and this one definitely is a must try. These caves are next to governor's house and the story is - a dacoit used to live in these natural caves and whenever he gets some info regarding the money transfer, he used to come out of the cave and stole the money. As the caves are some 10-12 km long, no one was able to catch him ever. Right now there are 6 caves that are open and the length of the caves that are open to the tourists are few 100 metres only. The government should focus more on such tourist destinations. I can clearly see that it could be a very good spot for genuine cave excursion if some more effort is done on these caves by the tourism development of India

title: Caves
review: The steep steps makes it difficult to climb. You need to have good footwear and stamina to climb those steep steps.

title: A must see in Nainital.
review: Eco cave park is a good place.  There are 6 caves of different difficulty level.  the temp reduces as you go down.  the caves are very old and it really gives you a adventurous feeling while crawling and climbing the caves.  lot of work needs to be done by the administration to improve the location.  if adequate steps taken, this one may become a good crowd puller.

title: Very nice tourist spot to experience.
review: Kept very clean and very unique experience. Not suitable for children and Aged people as some caves are really conjusted and with very less space.

title: Good idea to get everybody involved.
review: This garden is fun experience which gets everybody involved. The different terrains in the garden are a surprise package.

title: Resident for the Tiger and Panther.
review: An entry fee of Rs.35/- seemed too steep for a look at these caves...believed to be the habitat of tigers and panthers.  Mind your head when climbing into the caves and the rock faces are pretty slippery and steep.  Nothing much to see..curiosity got the better of us so we ventured into the caves and returned dissapointed.

title: Nice
review: Well thought and quite big area to cover infact we got tired after few treks and tunnels. It was real fun to see our college girls who were scared enough to enter the caves! it was fun and A cup of hot coffee sitting in a gazebo refreshed us along with the mystic view of nature which had a magic everywhere!

title: nice
review: its a beautiful network of natural caves lighted up , they say animals stayed in these caves before nainital got inhabited .now they are well maintained for tourists

title: Unique Idea
review: Good physical excercise but its unique idea. I loved the way it has been designed and developed. Please do not try if you are not physically in good condition, having asthama or breathing problem or heart or BP problem. As it needs heavy physical activity. But its worth visiting.

title: Unique and a new experience
review: This is a unique place and whoever made it had a great idea. They are a series of seven caves, increasingly difficult and small, named after different animals through which you venture. The caves all have lights and exit after each one so you can leave if you cant manage, There is a small fee to pay when you enter the park. Around the caves is a park where you can relax and a food stall.

title: Really Good One
review: The Eco Cave Garden is a must place to see in Nainitaal. It has many caves named on animals like panther cave, tiger cave, etc..  I like it very much along with my 5 yrs old son. He also very much excited. Its a unique experience to travel through these seven caves. The caves have lights and one can easily go out if they dont want to continue to another cave.

title: Decent
review: Its nice if you like hiking and exploring. Good for a couple trip. Try to go early in the morning as there will be chance of watching a few animals. Recommended

title: Well maintained !!!
review: Maintaining such place to such nice extent is just lovely.. Though there is not much exciting about this place but something new is always better than the old sight seeing :)

title: A new and refeshing experience
review: This is by far the newest thing experienced by me and I would love to go here again.

title: Eco Caves
review: These caves are very good to see.  One can feel a low temperature even in the month of June inside these caves.  Most of the caves are closed now a these days.  Actually previously it was very gud but now a these days it is more or less a park.

title: Saw this kind of a thing first time
review: The 6 caves are beautifully made in a manner to retain its natural look. Really breathtaking ! Literally!! worth giving it a try.

title: hard to go but was nice
review: first we went to tiger cave it was difficult to go up and down with narrow steps. when we go out we saw the panther cave it was the opposite steps but was much narrow than tiger cave it was fun , thr

title: Woohoo... Finally something to enjoy
review: My oh my... there was indeed something that I liked in Nainital.. The place is awesome... Has 6 caves that offer really nice adventure, as you need to bend, show flexibility, crawl, climb and have fun while you enter and come out of Panther, Tiger, Ape, Pocupine, Bat and Flying Fox caves.. It was the highlight of my trip

title: Difficult but good experience
review: There are not many things to do in Nainital, so I guess if you have time do visit this place. Once you are inside, it is nice. But it will be difficult for old people and big sized people. There are 6 caves, we only went to the first one. It's only the experience of walking inside the cave and the cool ambiance, there is nothing more to it.

title: For kids
review: Good for kids ! Quite possible that you go into the cave and come out hurt, so better watch the height. Rest its fun for kids and a ok thing for adults who can watch their heads and can bend themselves!

title: Excellent for the family
review: We didn't know what to expect.  Bat-filled or otherwise infested caves?  We found some excellently maintained caves, that most of us could make our way through, and it was a fantastic family experience.  Our first trekking through several caves, and it was fully worth it.  Strongly recommended for families with kids.

title: exciting..best of fun
review: it was awesome.. i went with my son and wife.. there are alot of caves....for tiger, panther, apes,bats etc...u need to crawl, bend, jump and what not...though there are no animals of course it was a hello of experience

title: nothing exceptional to visit
review: nothing so good to visit only caves but no restaurant etc to spend time. nothing exceptional. please avoid going if you have small kid as its not easy to move in the cave.

title: A sheer waste of time
review: Ths is a bogus tourist spot they have artificilaly created to attract tourists with some caves which has been named after different animals. Can be surely kept out of the itinerary in a place like Nainital which is more famouus for its natural beauty amidst the lake and the surrounding mountains.

title: For kids only
review: Though we went to this place, but we felt it would be enjoyed more by school kids. You can see varous views of Nainital from here, but this would be recommended for kids and probably not for adults as the caves can get a bit tough to climb for elderly people.

title: A different experience-must visit
review: There are about 5 caves which are natural but a little modified to suit people of all ages. Although a few caves were difficult fro elderly people. There are 2-3 high points from where you can see good views of Nainital and surrounding area. There is a small amphitheatre with fountain. Some small eateries are also there who sell Maggi. Very well maintained. About 2 KM from Mall road towards Bara Pathar.

title: what a joke
review: unlimited fun with some afraidness.......................................
